item.title: How to Build a Successful Apparel Brand with Ryan Williams
item.itunes:title: How to Build a Successful Apparel Brand with Ryan Williams
item.description:
Ecommerce, production design, marketing–there’s a lot that goes into a successful apparel brand. The question Ryan wants you to consider is, what is your target audience actually wearing, and how can you create a brand that they’ll want to wear? 

Ryan Williams is an entrepreneur and a former Navy SEAL. He  founded Industry Threadworks as a response to the poor communication and unfulfilled promises he found from other apparel sourcing companies. Now, he prioritizes accuracy and reliability in his quickly growing Private Label service.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, follow along with Ryan’s journey, from his work as a SEAL to the foundation of his entrepreneurial career. He knows what it means to understand, visualize, and produce high-quality apparel for businesses. He loves his job, not just because he’s making tons of money and helping others do the same, but because he gets to bring his passion and energy to every project he works on. Every day, he solves problems, seeks alternative perspectives, and works to help businesses evolve.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/ryan-williams

item.title: 6 Pillars Needed to Build a Dominant Apparel Brand with Drew Laine
item.itunes:title: 6 Pillars Needed to Build a Dominant Apparel Brand with Drew Laine
item.description:
If you’ve ever wondered about what all goes into building an apparel brand, Drew Laine is the first person to talk to. If you’ve ever wanted to get serious about it but weren’t sure where to start, today’s episode is for you–from DTG printing to customer feedback, we’ve got everything you need in order to kickstart your own apparel line.

Born in Massachusetts, Drew Laine is an entrepreneur with thirteen businesses in his portfolio, from software to coaching. In his career, he is drawn to building and investing in businesses that both disrupt the status quo and make a social impact. He’s a philanthropist, too. His 501C3 charity, the PenaltyBox Foundation, provides support for members of the hockey community who have faced catastrophe or challenge.

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, build an apparel brand with Drew’s insight and Zack’s drive. Starting with the foundation, go through the branding and development you need pre-launch. Consider your target market, your product, your aesthetics, and how they all fit together. Use Drew’s six-step figure to maximize your income, make a connection, and then remarket to the same customers. By the end of this episode, you’ll have a variety of tangible ideas you can implement in your own apparel; from there, you’ll have no problem generating interest and making relationships with your customers and community.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/build-apparel-brand

item.title: Introduction to Inner Child Healing with Tiffany Toombs
item.itunes:title: Introduction to Inner Child Healing with Tiffany Toombs
item.description:
Have you ever experienced a lull of low energy that you just can’t shake? Or a feeling of uneasiness in public, or the overwhelming urge to scream or cry? Tiffany’s here to reassure you why all of those things are happening, and what you can do about it.

 

Tiffany Toombs is the founder of the Blue Lotus Mind Institute, a coaching business focused on helping others heal their traumas and find empowerment in themselves. She is certified in many practices including Archetypal therapy, Athletic therapy, and Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP). She’s here today to focus on inner child work, and introduce you to the world inside of yourself. 

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, step in for a session with coach Tiffany Toombs. She wants you to heal from your trauma, and she’s here to lead by example. First, she shares the challenging life that motivated her to learn, grow, and share her therapy skills with others. Next, she breaks down how the release of trauma and negativity works to free the body from stress, fat, and frustration. Finally, see what you can do to release the pent-up energy in your nervous system, and why completing the cycle is so important for your mental and physical health.

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/inner-child-healing

item.title: Mastering Breathwork with Marshal Gillen
item.itunes:title: Mastering Breathwork with Marshal Gillen
item.description:
Clear your slate, calm your mind. Even if you regularly feel high-strung like Marshal, all it takes is three minutes a day of conscious breathing to reset your mindset. Yes, it’s really that easy.

Marshal Gillen is an award-winning speaker and primal performance coach who has helped his clients earn over $114M in revenue. Over two million people have been impacted by his work. He’s come a long way; he’s overcome addictions, poverty, and hardship to be the leader he is today. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Marshal and Zach take a deep dive into the holistic lifestyle behind Alpha Underdog. They break down why it works–why going out in nature, breathing right, and tapping into your inner frequency will give you the full charge you need to feel satisfied each day. After tapping into today’s show, you’ll have your pick of self-care practices to experiment with–magnesium soaks, biohacking, grounding, you name it. If you’re ready to expand your self-care work, or if you’re looking for a way to hit the ground running, tune in to today’s conversation and come away with an arsenal of ways to recenter yourself.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/mastering-breathwork

item.title: Introduction to Ayahuasca with Neal Conlon
item.itunes:title: Introduction to Ayahuasca with Neal Conlon
item.description:
For Neal, it all comes back to community. That’s what fuels his entrepreneurial style, and what led him to start running Ayahuasca retreats.

Neal Conlon is a Marines veteran who dabbled in the corporate world, AI, and tech, before coming to alternative, plant-based medicine to heal his inner demons.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach jams with Neil about the power of Ayahuasca in self-healing. Neal has been right to the edge of life–he’s done everything, but there’s still a lot he’s had trouble letting go of. Through leading his men’s Ayahuasca retreats, he’s found a new way to connect with the people around him, and also find inner peace. For him, plant-based medicine is a tool you can use to break through trauma, limits, and backwards thinking–and he’s here today to explain how.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/neal-conlon

item.title: Ground Yourself, Grow Yourself with Paul Tokgozoglu
item.itunes:title: Ground Yourself, Grow Yourself with Paul Tokgozoglu
item.description:
Mind, body, soul, relationships, finance. If you take care of your body and develop your relationship with all five of these pillars, you will find the sort of energy and “natural high” that will allow you to unlock new heights–and Paul is here today to tell you how.

 

Paul Tokgozoglu has been working with Zach for over two years. He’s the President and CMO of Podcast Powertrain, and he works tirelessly every day to empower other movers & shakers to publish their podcasts to their target audiences. 

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, these two old friends jam about the empowerment and spiritual connection that they’ve found by getting out in nature. For them, something as simple as a hike can form a direct link between yourself and a bigger, higher power. Whether it’s going barefoot, breathing intentionally, or meditating, Paul wants you to dive into it; he swears by the power of the flow state that can be achieved by connecting to yourself. Tune in for a conversation about how to achieve the meditative “deep state,” use that energy to address inner turmoil, and come away with the clarity you need to tackle your week.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/paul-tokgozoglu

item.title: The Realest Advice for Worthwhile Investments with Joe Evangelisti
item.itunes:title: The Realest Advice for Worthwhile Investments with Joe Evangelisti
item.description:
How many excuses are you going to make until you cut yourself a paycheck out of your business’s profits? Joe wants you to sit down and have a real talk with yourself–and then give yourself a regular cut of your profit. 

Joe Evangelisti is the founder of a private  coaching practice. He specializes in assisting real estate investors, entrepreneurs, and business professionals as they exercise their true power and find their potential. Joe creates life-changing transformation by providing clients with the tools and strategies needed to create unstoppable momentum and break through obstacles. He’s helped hundreds of business owners to build better teams and increase their profits. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, tune in for an episode all about investing in, managing, and generating generational wealth. First, listen to Joe recount his journey, from building for the Navy to creating massive equity in development deals. Next, get a few pointers for managing your finances as an entrepreneur. Finally, use those tips to create tangible momentum for your wealth, and ride that wave all the way to the top.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/joe-evangelisti

item.title: The Small Business Surgeon with Samuel Smith
item.itunes:title: The Small Business Surgeon with Samuel Smith
item.description:
You may think you’ve achieved success, but were you able to hold on to it? Were you able to continue to maintain relationships and a healthy lifestyle while also flourishing in your career? As the bank account trends upwards, the lives of many entrepreneurs tend to head in the opposite direction.

Samuel Smith is no stranger to this cycle. As a lifelong entrepreneur, he has built two seven-figure companies, one of which he sold and the latter he lost, due to his vices. Now Samuel invests in real estate, has built a third successful business, and is dedicated to bringing entrepreneurs together to share their struggles and inspire perseverance.  

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Samuel dive deep into the dark side of entrepreneurship, the addiction to winning that can ultimately lead to your self-destruction. 

Listen in for an episode that will bring some security to your success. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/samuel-smith

item.title: It Ain't Rocket Surgery with Sales Astronaut Brian McKittrick
item.itunes:title: It Ain't Rocket Surgery with Sales Astronaut Brian McKittrick
item.description:
Have you ever considered that simplicity is the key to excelling? Fundamental processes and systems are the key to execution. Repeated, effective execution is a concept anyone is capable of mastering.  

Brian McKittrick is a sales master and the author of the new book It Ain't Rocket Surgery: 21 Simple Tips that will Take Your Sales to the Moon! For over 20 years Brian led, trained and encourages sales teams to excel in all areas of selling from retail to insurance. Now, Brian is focused on sharing his wisdom on his podcast and building an effective brand on social media.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Brian chat about perceptions of success and how small, simple, actionable tactics are the most effective way to build a winning team. The two also bond over their respective love for reading and how they apply the knowledge they gain to their own lives. Listen in for an episode that will dial in and simplify your sales strategy. 

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/brian-mckittrick

item.title: Sneaky - Good Marketing Strategies with Rich Schefren
item.itunes:title: Sneaky - Good Marketing Strategies with Rich Schefren
item.description:
The pandemic may have shifted many businesses online in recent years, but Rich Schefren had been virtually scaling and growing businesses well before the world went remote. 

 

Rich Schefren is the coach for Internet gurus and the Founder and President of Strategic Profits, an online business consulting firm. As an “Internet Marketing pioneer,” Rich is responsible for groundbreaking innovations such as the first automated webinar, the first viral free business report and has worked to popularize online business coaching since founding his company in 2005. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach picks Rich’s brain about how he creates launches and popularizes his marketing strategies. He also makes some suggestions for Zach to ramp up client acquisitions. Listen in for an episode that will dial in your business’ growth plan. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/rich-schefren

item.title: The Big "AHA" Moments and Best Takeaways of 2021
item.itunes:title: The Big "AHA" Moments and Best Takeaways of 2021
item.description:
The turn of a new year doesn’t mark a clean, blank slate. Each year builds on the last one. While it is is a chance for new goals, it is also an opportunity to reflect on what has worked, where you have been, and to use this knowledge to guide the direction of your future 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach looks back on his personal journey improving his mental and physical wellbeing while also investing in his own family and relationships. He shares his plans for 2022 and where this podcast will go next. Listen in for an episode that will get you looking beyond and back.

item.title: How to Heal the Body from Trauma with Tucker Max
item.itunes:title: How to Heal the Body from Trauma with Tucker Max
item.description:
Although trauma is a personalized experience, that doesn’t mean it can’t be passed to others and spread through multiple generations. Learn to identify what you have tucked away in your own self to avoid burying it into the lives of those you love. 

 

Tucker Max is the author of four New York Times bestsellers, the writer behind ‘The Tard Blog’, and a human being -- one that has worked for years to rewire his own dysfunctional behavior and heal from his past traumas. Through a combination of psycho and talk therapy, Tucker says he was able to rewrite not only the path of his future but also who he was to the core.

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Tucker go through different tactics on how to avoid passing your own trauma along to your kids. They also break down the different ways to take care of and heal your body and deal with your emotions without giving in to your vices along the way. Listen in for an episode that will get you rethinking what it really means to “man up.” 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/heal-body-trauma

item.title: Setting Annual Goals the Alpha Underdog Way
item.itunes:title: Setting Annual Goals the Alpha Underdog Way
item.description:
From vision boards to goal setting, the Underdog Empowerment team is all about forward momentum and not just making the most of life, but excelling it in the direction of your choosing. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach gets into how and why he sets annual goals and the process he uses by reflecting on how far he has come. He also breaks down how he sets goals relative to the days, weeks, and months and explains his system for goal tracking day-to-day. Listen in for an episode that will amp up your goals setting standards.

item.title: Building a Dominant Brand with a Podcast with Erik Allen
item.itunes:title: Building a Dominant Brand with a Podcast with Erik Allen
item.description:
Sharing stories empowers action. We take what we learn from those stories, apply it to our own, and continue learning how to grow as a person.  

Erik Allen is a podcast entrepreneur and content creator. Last year he purchased one of Zach’s courses and his brand excelled. However, before building a dominant brand, Erik grew up in a broken home with a complicated childhood and says he lived a “rockstar” lifestyle for many years, drinking and doing drugs. Over sixteen years ago he decided to change his life and has been sober ever since.  

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Erik connect over their childhood trauma and how they worked to overcome those experiences later in life. Erik also breaks down how he structures his every day to position him to be successful. Listen in for an episode that will empower you to overcome.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/erik-allen

item.title: Million Dollar Sports Cards with Khalil Randell
item.itunes:title: Million Dollar Sports Cards with Khalil Randell
item.description:
For beginner card collectors to football fanatics, there’s plenty of opportunities to begin capitalizing on your love of sports and all the knowledge that comes with it by making some long-term investments.

Khalil is the author of Million Dollar Sports Cards: A Golden Guide to Sports Card Collecting and Investing. He collected cards growing up, but eventually lost his entire collection when his childhood home was foreclosed on. It wasn’t until Khalil was working to put himself through grad school and won a lot of cards from his local Goodwill that he reinvigorated his love for the hobby and decided to start turning profits. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Khalil dive deep into the tactics around buying and selling cards in line with how those players are performing day-to-day. They also connect over their favorite athletes and how that influences the cards they are looking for. Listen in for an episode that will take you from hobbyist to entrepreneur. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/khalil-randell

item.title: Football Cards Investing 101 - Get Paid to Watch Football with Andy Cason
item.itunes:title: Football Cards Investing 101 - Get Paid to Watch Football with Andy Cason
item.description:
Turn something you are passionate about into a profitable hobby.

Andy Cason’s passion is football, specifically football cards. He is a fantasy football specialist and the host of the YouTube series "The Fantasy Football Card Quest." Andy has made a living from buying, selling and collecting sports cards and knows the ins and outs of how the hobby can be turned into a business as long as you have the passion and knowledge to see it through.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Andy connect over their love of football and how card collecting can be turned into a lucrative endeavor. Andy dives into the strategic aspect of card collecting, hobby jargon, and how he determines the value of each card. Listen in for an episode that will jumpstart your passion’s path to profit. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/andy-cason

item.title: Creating a Brand and Growing via PodMatch with Alex Sanfilippo
item.itunes:title: Creating a Brand and Growing via PodMatch with Alex Sanfilippo
item.description:
There’s more to growing your brand than sharing insights and running ads. Learn how to increase your brand’s growth organically and accelerate your business. 

 

Alex Sanfilippo is the founder of Podmatch and the host of the Creating a Brand Podcast. Alex is also a serial entrepreneur and innovator who, after years of starting, growing, selling, and helping develop companies has now shifted gears to help others do the same. Podmatch is a software service that streamlines brand building by automatically matching guests to podcast hosts.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Alex and Zach get into the tactical aspects of building a brand beyond your own platform. Alex explains how he turned a simple business idea into a platform that helps businesses grow and excel. Listen in for an episode that will revamp your organic reach. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/alex-sanfilippo

item.title: Coach Yu on Scaling with Dennis Yu
item.itunes:title: Coach Yu on Scaling with Dennis Yu
item.description:
How much time do you waste during the day going through the same motions and completing the task? Implementing systems and processes within your business will cut down that time wasted and open up untapped growth potential.

Dennis Yu specializes in streamlining businesses and is the CTO of BlitzMetrics. As a search engine engineer, he took the knowledge he gained from building the analytics for Yahoo and turned it into a guide for others. Three years ago, he gave Zach a valuable piece of advice that also gave his then-fledgling business some traction. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Dennis breaks down the ways systems and processes can not only increase revenue, but also make the business more effective and well-positioned for growth. Listen in for an episode that will scale and shape your next endeavour.

item.itunes:title: Strung Out for 17 Years Straight to Building Recovery Brands with Lawrence Stewart
item.description:
It’s just as important to look back as it is to look forward. Reflect on who you once were and, if nothing else, be grateful for everything you have learned along the way.

Lawrence Stewart grew up in Fergeson, Missouri, and was raised by a single mom. He was next to Zach in some of his darkest moments while struggling with addiction. Lawrence has now been sober for almost five years and is dedicated to helping others through his platform Sober Life Gang.  

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Lawrence reconnect and reflect on how far they have both come since their lives before recovery. Lawrence also looks back on what motivated him to want to fight his demons. Listen in for an episode that will continue to inspire perseverance. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/lawrence-stewart

item.title: What I'd Do If I Had to Start Over Right Now
item.itunes:title: What I'd Do If I Had to Start Over Right Now
item.description:
What is your definition of winning? We all love different things. We all live different lives. We all have the ability to win, but what winning means to one life doesn’t necessarily carry over into the next.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach celebrates the show's 300th episode with his answer to a question he has been asking each of his guests recently: what would you tell yourself if you had to start over right now with absolutely nothing besides the wisdom you have gained in your life? Listen in for an episode that will get you thinking about all you have to offer the world. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/what-i-would-do-if-i-started-over

item.title: Mark Manson - How Men Get Stronger
item.itunes:title: Mark Manson - How Men Get Stronger
item.description:
Are you aware of what drives your emotions? Does your self-awareness extend beyond your immediate feelings and work to decipher your reactions? 

 

Mark Manson has authored three books, two of which -- The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck, and Everything Is F*cked: A Book About Hope -- made the New York Times bestsellers list. He uses his writing, backed by psychological research, to help further conversations around personal development and happiness on a global scale. 

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Mark work through how understanding the meaning we attach to emotions will benefit all facets of our lives. Mark explains how developing emotional intelligence on a personal level and to the point where you can understand the actions of others will make you overall, a better human. Listen in for an episode that will let you get lost in the depths of your own mind.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/mark-manson

item.title: My Response When They Say I've Changed
item.itunes:title: My Response When They Say I've Changed
item.description:
We all should be growing and evolving as we work towards achieving our next goal. Life keeps moving forward, so if we don’t keep striving to be better, well, then what is the point? Do you strive to maintain the same existence over your lifetime? Probably not.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach embraces a negative, one-star review from one of his listeners and explains why it was impossible for the show to not evolve and change with him. Zach quotes Andy Frisella’s sentiment that says in order to be successful, you have to be humble in your approach and cocky in your execution. Listen in for an episode that will streamline your struggles against change.

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/response-to-change

item.title: The Physical Product Component to Alpha Underdog with Callye Keen
item.itunes:title: The Physical Product Component to Alpha Underdog with Callye Keen
item.description:
Is your brand tangible for your consumer? Are they able to connect with your company through a physical product?

Callye Keen is the Chief Business Officer at K-Form, a product coach and serial. Callye also is the host of the End Hype podcast, where he breaks down how to transform a product idea into a business reality. He works with entrepreneurs day in and day out to help brands evolve and creating physical products to use as consumer engagement tools. His goal is to help companies grow with his unique strategies, innovative designs, and manufacturing expertise.   

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Callye and Zach break down the benefits of pairing a tangible product to an idea. Callye also stresses the importance of understanding your existing audience before you attempt to grow your brand in a specific direction. Listen in for an episode that will get your brand’s image back in focus. 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/physical-product

item.title: Dr. Dan Engle on MDMA Assisted Psychotherapy and A Dose of Hope
item.itunes:title: Dr. Dan Engle on MDMA Assisted Psychotherapy and A Dose of Hope
item.description:
Do you know how to claim your grief and pursue an inner resolution? Many people bury their emotions believing it makes them stronger, but often times holding in trauma handicaps other emotional progress down the line. 

Dr. Dan Engle M.D. is the author of A Dose of Hope and a psychiatrist who combines aspects of regenerative medicine, psychedelics research, integrative spirituality and peak performance. His medical degree is from the University of Colorado in Denver, and his child and adolescent psychiatry fellowship degree is from Oregon Health & Science University. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach speaks with Dr. Engle about the experience and his personal concerns about participating in MDMA-assisted psychotherapy. Dr. Engle encourages Zach to embrace the transitional work associated with taking these medications in a controlled environment. Listen in for an episode that will get you rethinking how to orient your inner truth.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/dr-dan-engle

item.title: Are Your Sales Dialed In with Steve Taylor
item.itunes:title: Are Your Sales Dialed In with Steve Taylor
item.description:
How much faith do you have in your own work? How passionate are you about the product you are selling? That sense of confidence may be playing a role in your success.  

Steve started his career in sales at 14 years old, selling cars off his dad’s lot in rural Oregon. Now he is a successful insurance salesperson who has made it to the top of his industry with traditional tactics and compassion for the customer. Steve also hosts the No Bull Business and Brews podcast alongside Jason Graybeal.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Steve reflect on their past few days at APA Mastermind in Arizona. Steve tells Zach about the character traits he believes are essential for any salesperson to see success. Listen in for an episode that will get your tactics dialed in. 

 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/steve-taylor

item.title: What Plant-Based Medicine Can Be with Gary Roberts
item.itunes:title: What Plant-Based Medicine Can Be with Gary Roberts
item.description:
Are you trapped in your mind or body? Maybe both? Plant-based medicine can help you relax but it can also be a mode to recovery for anyone from athletes to addicts trying to rebuild what is broken. 

Gary Roberts is the founder and owner of Pure Body Zen, a firefighter, and the host of the Good Dudes Grow Podcast. After tragically losing his daughter to opioid addiction, Gary discovered the healing nature of cannabis products and set out on a mission to not only educate others about plant-based medicine but also help those struggling with their mental and physical heath find the path to recovery.  

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Gary tells Zach about his dream: to build a recovery center that uses plant-based medicine to help those suffering from addiction and trauma. He explains how the facility will embrace scientifically proven therapies, separating it from the experimental nature that is often associated with products like CBD. Listen in for an episode that will educate you on this natural healing process. 

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/plant-based-medicine

item.title: I Evolved and So Did My Core Values
item.itunes:title: I Evolved and So Did My Core Values
item.description:
Has the fundamentals of who you are been influenced by your own actions? Realigning your core values as you experience life is the only way to ensure you are always following your north stars.  

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach kicks off solo and walks through his recently reassessed set of core values. He explains why he realized the values he developed during early life needed to be acknowledged before he allowed himself to keep moving forward. Listen in for an episode that will help you realign the person you strive to become.

item.title: Liam Babcock Entrepreneurship and Delayed Gratification
item.itunes:title: Liam Babcock Entrepreneurship and Delayed Gratification
item.description:
Did your parents ever tell you to not spend all your money in one place? Well, that’s exactly what Zach is encouraging his son Liam to do.

Liam Babcock is a young entrepreneur who runs a lemonade stand with twin brother Landon. Following up on Landon’s analysis from a previous episode, Liam gives his take on the success of the stand and the improvements they will institute for its next installation.   

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Liam and Zach also chat about how to save money instead of impulsively making purchases. Later on, Liam gives an update about his upcoming football season. Listen in for an episode that will make your day a little brighter.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/liam-babcock

item.title: 1 Percent Better - EVERYDAY (RTRT 10)
Most People Run Away From This
item.itunes:title: Most People Run Away From This
item.description:
Are you willing to face all aspects of your past head-on? If you haven’t put in the work to make peace with your past negative experiences and trauma, you are likely carrying them through your present.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach explains how he plans to face the trauma from his childhood and early life head-on. He walks through his plan for psychedelic therapy and explains how he is going to share that journey through this show. Listen in for an episode that will inspire your own second coming.

item.title: Landon Babcock Business Lessons From A 7 Year Old
item.itunes:title: Landon Babcock Business Lessons From A 7 Year Old
item.description:
Have you set your business up for success? It doesn’t matter how small or large the operation - set a goal and maintain that vision.

Zach’s son Landon Babcock is a budding entrepreneur and master lemonade salesman. At only seven years old he is already setting records in the industry by pulling in a three-digit revenue in only two hours. However, to Landon’s dismay, the profit had to be divided up between him and his team which encouraged him to revisit his business plan. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Landon discuss the lessons learned from their lemonade stand and how the successful operation helped realign Landon’s vision board. Listen in for an episode that will simply make you smile.

item.title: Tucker Max - Healing Past Traumas And Rewiring Limiting Beliefs
item.itunes:title: Tucker Max - Healing Past Traumas And Rewiring Limiting Beliefs
item.description:
Are you trapped in a cycle -- deriving power from your own dysfunction? Who you have been doesn’t have to roll over into the person you can become. 

Tucker Max is the author of four New York Times bestsellers, the writer behind ‘The Tard Blog’, and a human being -- one that has worked for years to rewire his own dysfunctional behavior. Through a combination of psycho and talk therapy, Tucker says he was able to rewrite not only the path of his future but who he was to the core.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Tucker and Zach dive into their personal journeys in healing from past trauma and discuss the risk, benefits, and varieties of illicit psychedelic medicines. Listen in for an episode that will rewrite the possibility of who you can become.

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/tucker-max

item.title: A Tactical Blueprint To Building Generational Wealth With D.K. Hutch
item.itunes:title: A Tactical Blueprint To Building Generational Wealth With D.K. Hutch
item.description:
Did you learn about long-term investments or 401Ks in school? No? We didn’t think so. Now is the time to figure out how to manage your financial health for the long term. It’s just as important as making the money in the first place.

3gf9tbvt

D.K. Hutch is a virtually self-taught, financial expert and CEO of The Legacy Company. He understands the ins and outs of managing your personal finances and making smart investments. D.K.’s hunger for knowledge, extensive experience, and diverse skill set have allowed him to excel in his career. 

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and D.K. break down the basics of insurance, investing, trading cryptocurrency, and how to grow your existing assets. D.K. explains the various levels of risk and reward that come with dispersing your money and which options are best to help it grow. Listen in for an episode that will get your finances in order.

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/dk-hutch

item.title: Do You Even Know What Winning Really Is?
item.itunes:title: Do You Even Know What Winning Really Is?
item.description:
How critically have you thought about your legacy? Most people aren’t successful because they subscribe to everybody else’s definition of success without ever deciding what it means to their own self. 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach flies solo as he dives into the process of coming up with long-term goals and setting boundaries between work and life, explaining how being this intentional has already brought him some success and letting out some spoilers about Alpha Underdog in the process. Tune in for an insightful episode about what it really means to accomplish your dreams.

item.title: The Tactical Entrepreneur With Steve Schabacker
item.itunes:title: The Tactical Entrepreneur With Steve Schabacker
item.description:
What’s at the core of your business? See, industries and companies fail when everybody does things the way they’ve “always been done.” To thrive, you’ve got to have your own values and your own priorities in place.

Steve Schabaker is the co-founder of Sheepdog Firearms and a bestselling author, entrepreneur, and marketer. Between his content and his businesses, Steve is giving firearm owners and armed professionals the education they need and setting a new standard for training centers and shops in his industry.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Steve dig into Steve’s start as an entrepreneur and his current businesses, how customer service is getting put on the backburner by a lot of major firearms companies, and why results require consistency. Join in for a short-but-hard-hitting rundown on what it takes to raise the standards for an entire industry. 

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/steve-schabacker

item.title: Building A Business Around A Sports Passion With Colt Schroeder
item.itunes:title: Building A Business Around A Sports Passion With Colt Schroeder
item.description:
That thing you’re passionate about can be a business. As long as you can bring a love for the topic, a greater mission, and a commitment to doing the work to the table, the hobby you’re 110% all-in for is exactly the right thing to help you make your impact.

Colt Schroeder is the host of the Buffalo Nerd Sports Podcast and a lifelong, die-hard fan of the Buffalo Bills. His show exists to engage with his fellow Bills fans, share some team history, and highlight a different charity each week that’s doing some good in its community.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Colt jam on motivating yourself to break out of the script and do what fires you up every morning, the exciting changes the Buffalo Bills are making that spell a new future for the team, and what you can expect when you tune into the podcast. Listen in for some sports insight and lessons in pure drive from someone who’s committed to betting on himself.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/colt-schroeder

item.title: The Breakthrough Society With Irvin Retiz
item.itunes:title: The Breakthrough Society With Irvin Retiz
item.description:
How do you tackle a new challenge? Once you’ve started your business, it’s easy to settle in and think that you’ve got everything figured out. But life will eventually throw you a curveball or two, and how you respond to those moments says a lot about who you are and how far you’re willing to go for the things - and people - that you care about.

 

Irvin Retiz is the host of the Breakthrough Society Podcast and the founder of Retiz Electric. His podcast, and the community he’s developed around it, is built on the desire to help other driven entrepreneurs break through to the next level in life and in business.

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Irvin jam on Irvin’s entrepreneurial upbringing and the start of his own business, the pursuit of excellence even in the smallest details, and why building great connections is easily the most valuable use of your time. Tune in for the ongoing story of a young guy who’s on his way to conquering the world. 

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/irvin-retiz/

item.title: The Reason Why I Take CBD And Delta 8 With Gary Roberts
item.itunes:title: The Reason Why I Take CBD And Delta 8 With Gary Roberts
item.description:
What’s your first thought when someone mentions marijuana? We all heard the “Just Say No” campaigns and the warnings from our parents and teachers when we were little - but all that fear and avoidance is keeping us from discovering one specific element of cannabis that has the power to heal and help us live a better quality of life. 

Gary Roberts is the founder and owner of Pure Body Zen, a firefighter and the host of the Good Dudes Grow Podcast. His journey into the truth about cannabis products started after his own enlightening experience and a tragic family loss. Currently, Gary is dedicated to clearing up the myths and misconceptions around CBD, setting high standards for product quality, and using his insight and products to heal others from the inside out.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Gary dive deep on addressing some of the widely held myths about cannabis products, how Gary got his start with CBD, the challenges of improving on industry standards for testing and product quality, and how Gary goes about educating his customers and audience on the benefits (and the truth about) CBD. Join in for an episode that will give you nothing but the facts about the healing ingredient you’re missing out on.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/gary-roberts

item.title: Building And Scaling A Physical Product Business With Callye Keen
item.itunes:title: Building And Scaling A Physical Product Business With Callye Keen
item.description:
How do you translate your big vision into something your customers could hold in their hand? In a world of fake Internet gurus and people who just sell fluff, companies who want to serve their people at the next level can unlock massive growth with the help of a great physical product.

Witnessing a huge range of strategies, tactics, successes, and failures in product development and manufacturing led Callye Keen to turn his experience into the Red Blue Collective framework. 

Now, Callye mentors brilliant misfits to help them generate $50k+ in 90 days of added revenue without the use of overly complicated funnels, ads on Facebook, or “questionable tactics.” The Collective takes the insight and strategies Callye has gained over the years and uses it to help entrepreneurs access impactful opportunities, deliver valuable products, and multiply their audience of customers while reducing both time and investment.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Callye dig into what physical products can do for an existing business in terms of their audience, how Callye understands and best serves his own audience, and building the fundamental philosophy and mission behind your brand so you can break out of mediocrity and make a real impact. Tune in to expand your idea of what’s possible - and what the next big move should be - for you and your business.

 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/callye-keen

item.title: Leveling Up Your Knowledge Base With Alex Vonderhaar
item.itunes:title: Leveling Up Your Knowledge Base With Alex Vonderhaar
item.description:
When was the last time you tried connecting to your own consciousness? As entrepreneurs, we’re so busy trying to hack our audience’s minds, we don’t pay attention to our own. But once you can put everything you experience in a wider context, from business to walks in the woods, the perspective you gain will make you the person your people seek out to tell them the truth and give them what they need.

Alex Vonderhaar is back to break down more big-brain techniques and knowledge for marketers and entrepreneurs who want to go deeper with their audience.

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Alex jam on how Alex is taking his personal development to the cellular level with psychedelics and sensory experiences, getting into the systems and processes of scaling a killer business, the discoveries around aliens and space structures that we might be on the verge of, the ups and downs of going all-in on cryptocurrency, and how Alex and his team are improving on the bullshit tactics other marketing agencies are using to screw their customers over. Listen in for a brain-bending episode that will have you contemplating more than just your marketing funnels.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/alex-vonderhaar-2

item.title: Building An Empire Of Impact From The Ground Up With Patrick Bolanos
item.itunes:title: Building An Empire Of Impact From The Ground Up With Patrick Bolanos
item.description:
Why do you get up and get to work every day? The answer is different for everyone. It might be money, validation, or going through the motions...but if you wake up in the morning in pursuit of making an impact, giving crazy amounts of value, and serving your community, your family, and your own wellbeing, you’ll quickly rise above the rest.

 

Patrick Bolanos is a serial entrepreneur and the founder of Trailer King Builders, Working for a Dream Baseball Academy, and his nonprofit, Helping Kids Round First. Patrick also hosts the Working for a Dream Podcast, where he shares his story and his insight on building an empire up from nothing.

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Patrick dig into how Patrick stepped into his purpose and his talent through his food truck business, the mission behind the Working for a Dream Baseball Academy, how Patrick is creating impact and delivering value for the kids in his Academy, at home, and through his businesses and podcast, and why you need to start each day with gratitude and the determination to stay consistent with your healthy habits. Tune in to get your focus back on giving maximum value to the people who need you.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/patrick-bolanos

item.title: Looking Back And Moving Forward
item.itunes:title: Looking Back And Moving Forward
item.description:
What big steps have you taken lately? The most successful people in the game will tell you that life requires constant learning and healthy progress. And when you take each step, looking back on the lessons that moved you forward is key.

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach jams solo on getting ready for his big studio move and reflects back on UE’s first brick-and-mortar space, how the wisdom he’s taken from all these podcast interviews has translated into a whole new lifestyle, and the next big venture in the works from Zach and the team. Tune in for an insightful update from someone moving into a powerful new season of life.

item.title: Spirituality Woo Woo Deep Dive With Alison Lager
item.itunes:title: Spirituality Woo Woo Deep Dive With Alison Lager
item.description:
When was the last time you stopped fighting and pushing and stressing and chose to sit back and just exist in your natural grace and creativity instead? The gifts we’re born with get buried under years of conditioning and all kinds of BS - but we reach our potential when we learn to unlock them again.

 

Alison Lager is the founder and owner of Lager Counseling Services and the host of the Alison Answers #MissionAwake podcast. Through her content and her client work, Alison is dedicated to helping others break out of the prison of mediocrity and access creativity, awareness, and truth.

 

On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Alison break down the difference between grace, truth, and grit, plus how each one factors into your life, the conditioning we’re exposed to from a young age and how it influences us from the inside out as we grow up to influence the next generation, and using wise observations and questions to dig into the truth of a matter instead of reacting. Listen in for an interview that will calm some of the daily chaos and stress you experience and help you access your highest self.

 

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/alison-lager

item.title: Creating A 7 Figure Digital Course Offer With Anthony Morrison
item.itunes:title: Creating A 7 Figure Digital Course Offer With Anthony Morrison
item.description:
“Necessity is the mother of invention.”
 
Nothing could be more true for the underdog entrepreneurs of the world who found themselves needing to start a business after their lives got turned upside down - but having been forged in fire is the common denominator among some of the most legendary businesses on the planet.
 
Anthony Morrison is best known as the founder of the “Partner with Anthony” program, which is designed to give entrepreneurs the resources and advice they need to launch and grow their business with massive success. Since its inception, the program has gained hundreds of rave reviews and set the standard for business coaches everywhere.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Anthony dive deep on the financial disaster that kickstarted Anthony’s journey as an entrepreneur and a coach, how buyers respond to various types of advertising and content (plus how to use those preferences to make your content more effective), and how to structure your courses or coaching sessions to maximize your “yes”es. Listen in for under-the-radar tips to revolutionize how you bring clients into your business.
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/anthony-morrison

item.title: Former NFL Player Quentin Gause On Habits And Mental Toughness
item.itunes:title: Former NFL Player Quentin Gause On Habits And Mental Toughness
item.description:
What does it take to reach the kind of success you see every week on ESPN? Although we think of pro football players like gods or superheroes, they’re just people who learned the secrets of hard work and resilience and made shit happen. Now - what would you be capable of if you could harness the same energy?
 
Quentin Gause is a former NFL athlete with a career track record that includes time spent with the Philadelphia Eagles, the Denver Broncos and the New England Patriots. After leaving athletics, Quentin founded Iron Visuals, a visual marketing and branding consultancy that exists to help entrepreneurs and business owners reach their audience with quality content, branding and visual media. Quentin also lends his experience and expertise to kids hoping to earn football scholarships and - eventually - careers in the NFL, and serves as a fitness trainer alongside his other pursuits.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Quentin break down how a pro athlete attacks each day and maximizes productivity in every part of his life, the teams and players that inspire Quentin daily, and how the lessons learned during his career on the field have led Quentin to grow to great heights in business. Tune in for an interview with a true achiever that will get you fired up to push forward through whatever roadblock you got in front of you. 
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/quentin-gause

item.title: Tactical Marketing Strategies That Generate More Money With Alex Vonderhaar
item.itunes:title: Tactical Marketing Strategies That Generate More Money With Alex Vonderhaar
item.description:
What would you pay to make sure you stay in your customers' brains 24/7? Now, what if you could get a head start on all that knowledge from one podcast episode?
 
Alex Vonderhaar is a neuro-marketer, speaker, entrepreneur, podcast host and the CEO of Hidden Falls Media, a company that exists to bring psychology and neuroscience to entrepreneurs and marketers looking to scale and achieve astronomical growth.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Alex dig into how Alex uses psychology to do marketing (and sell) like a genius, the mind games that go into pricing products and how to make them work for you, how to separate yourself from the dishonest marketers on social media and create straightforward content that attracts engagement, and introducing a sensory piece to your products and brand to completely change your customer experience. Listen in for a mind-blowing interview that will get you started marketing at a truly subconscious level.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/alex-vonderhaar

item.title: Sales Tales With Andrew Sayles
item.itunes:title: Sales Tales With Andrew Sayles
item.description:
Most of us sell every day of our lives. In business, at the dinner table with the kids, engaging on Facebook...the ability to sell will take you everywhere in life. But there's a lot more to great sales than charm or a persuasive attitude, which is why anyone looking to learn how to sell like a superstar should be listening to the best of the best.
 
Andrew Sayles early experience with sales landed him in prison. Afterward, Andrew doubled down on the skill set he already had and started climbing the career ladder at the speed of light. Now, alongside his work as the VP of Business Development at Solis Energy Services, Andrew uses his status as a "professional life changer" and host of the Sayles Tales Podcast to teach other driven entrepreneurs how to hustle harder and win bigger.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Andrew jam on Andrew's first, less-than-legit sales gig, how he got the right mentorship and worked his way up into entrepreneurship using his sales skills, the lessons Andrew learned doing door-to-door sales (including one that involved a shotgun), and hitting just the right tone to project confidence and close leads constantly. Listen in for a 100% no-bullshit look at what it really takes to crush sales - and why there's no reason you can't do it, too.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/andrew-sayles
 
Get More Involved: 
 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

item.content:encoded:
Most of us sell every day of our lives. In business, at the dinner table with the kids, engaging on Facebook...the ability to sell will take you everywhere in life. But there's a lot more to great sales than charm or a persuasive attitude, which is why anyone looking to learn how to sell like a superstar should be listening to the best of the best.   Andrew Sayles early experience with sales landed him in prison. Afterward, Andrew doubled down on the skill set he already had and started climbing the career ladder at the speed of light. Now, alongside his work as the VP of Business Development at Solis Energy Services, Andrew uses his status as a "professional life changer" and host of the Sayles Tales Podcast to teach other driven entrepreneurs how to hustle harder and win bigger.   On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Andrew jam on Andrew's first, less-than-legit sales gig, how he got the right mentorship and worked his way up into entrepreneurship using his sales skills, the lessons Andrew learned doing door-to-door sales (including one that involved a shotgun), and hitting just the right tone to project confidence and close leads constantly. Listen in for a 100% no-bullshit look at what it really takes to crush sales - and why there's no reason you can't do it, too.   Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/andrew-sayles   Get More Involved:

item.title: Prison Time To 7 Figures With Bobby Jones
item.itunes:title: Prison Time To 7 Figures With Bobby Jones
item.description:
How do you begin to pull yourself up by your bootstraps when you’re starting from rock bottom - and once you start to rise up, how do you keep that momentum going all the way to the top? To stay on that upward trend, you’ll need luck, good people around you, and some serious street smarts.
 
Bobby “Mr. Bright Side” Jones fought his way up from prison time and a lack of possibilities to his current role as the president and CEO of Bright Side Roofing and Siding. Through his business and his commitment to philanthropy, Bobby serves and inspires others to boldly pursue their potential.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Bobby dive into how 
Bobby’s time in prison completely transformed every piece of his identity, facing down the challenges that come with transitioning back into society, building a team that lets you focus on the high-leverage parts of your business, and some hard-hitting advice to the Clubhouse audience on topics ranging from the value of investing in relationships to handling tough situations with team members who don’t fit your values to growing your audience and more. Listen in for an interview that will give you the insight you need to start leveling your shit up in the ways that matter.
 
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/bobby-jones

item.title: Not A Cookie-Cutter Coach With Jaime Filer
item.itunes:title: Not A Cookie-Cutter Coach With Jaime Filer
item.description:
In a world filled with self-described "gurus" selling bad advice, what sets a real coach - selling real results - apart? It's a rare mix of strong values, life experience that drives them, the genuine desire to serve their people well...and that's just the start.
 
Jaime Filer's work as a personal trainer came from the fight of her life within her own body and the desire to carry her father's legacy. Now, Jaime brings her unique training approach to every client to instill a sense of confidence and get them moving powerfully forward.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Jaime cover Jaime’s battle back from severe anorexia to peak health, how Jaime takes her status as a part of the LGBTQ community and makes it her motivation to serve and represent her people proudly, and the differences between quick success and lasting achievement. Tune in for an interview that will get you pumped up, inspired, and ready to crush whatever pursuit lights you up.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/jaime-filer

item.title: Sean Whalen Lions Not Sheep
item.itunes:title: Sean Whalen Lions Not Sheep
item.description:
You're lying to yourself. In fact, most of us are. It's how we're raised - we're taught to be quiet and polite and follow the plan, and we swallow our individualities and drives and needs to fit in. Time to break that silence and speak your truth.
 
Sean Whalen found his liberation after he hit rock bottom and lost everything, including his wife, his kids, his money, and his respect. It was only then that he hauled himself up, took responsibility and forged his future in radical honesty with himself and the rest of the world. Sean is also the founder and CEO of Lions Not Sheep, a global movement that reflects his drive to help others stand out as leaders rather than society's followers.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Sean jam on pursuing the truth after a lifetime of being programmed to lie, how to build yourself up to your full potential (and why you deserve to have a little bit of an ego), and the indescribable freedom Sean found when he dove into his darkness and made it his message. Listen in for an interview that will scare you to death and, ultimately, set you free.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/sean-whalen

item.title: The Alpha Podcasting Association
item.itunes:title: The Alpha Podcasting Association
item.description:
Who's in your corner as you run your business? If you're still hanging around people who play small or fake, ego-driven "influencers," you need a better network. It can be tough to figure out who to take advice from at first, but the real killers always manage to rise to the top…
 
The men of the Alpha Podcasting Association all share a common set of values that has landed them where they are, first and foremost a dedication to honesty, connections based on real relationships and a willingness to get in the trenches and do the work. With decades upon decades of experience between them, the chance to be a fly on the wall when they get together is a coveted opportunity.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach brings in the group of creators that make up the Alpha Podcasting Association Mastermind to share their insights on the insane growth that comes from having a network of high-level entrepreneurs who are dedicated to lifting each other up, pulling away from the fakes with a mix of consistency and straight-up hard work, and under-the-radar social media strategies for growing your business. This is not your average interview - tune in for an outrageous amount of insight from half a dozen true badasses.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/alpha-podcasting-association

item.title: The Burn With Ben Newman
item.itunes:title: The Burn With Ben Newman
item.description:
What gets you ready to face the day every morning before your feet even hit the floor? Before you answer that - it's not your next paycheck, or the beer you crack open at 6 PM. Your burn needs to run much deeper.
 
Ben Newman is an acclaimed performance coach, author and speaker who motivates and inspires professional athletes, CEO's, sales teams and organizations across the globe, including heavyweights like Microsoft, the US Army and the Minnesota Vikings…to name just a few. Ben helps his clients and audiences get in touch with the fire that keeps them moving forward to the next level.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Ben dig into discovering your purpose and pursuing it relentlessly, how Ben’s mother inspired him to fight through the tough parts of life and encourage others to do the same, and the unbelievable success that finds you when you learn to let go of the result. Join the conversation to get your head out of the online entrepreneurship haze and back onto a path that leads where you want it to go.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/ben-newman
 
Get More Involved:

item.title: The Second In Command COO Whisperer Cameron Herold
item.itunes:title: The Second In Command COO Whisperer Cameron Herold
item.description:
Who is it that keeps legendary businesses running smoothly and growing fast? Behind every huge brand is an operational genius - and if you look in the right places and listen closely, you might be able to snag some of their secrets.
 
Cameron Herold - or, as he's better known, "The Business Growth Guru" - is the COO of 1-800-GOT-JUNK, the founder of COO Alliance, and an acclaimed speaker, author and consultant who helps business leaders around the world achieve the dynamic, exponential growth they're after.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Cameron dig into Cameron's experience building 1-800-GOT-JUNK into the industry superpower that it is, growing your business as a franchise vs. going the corporate path, and answers to Clubhouse questions about everything from podcasting to SEO to leveraging your content and beyond. Tune in for an interview and Q&A that packs a lifetime of experience and insight into one unmissable episode.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/cameron-herold

item.title: Automation For Domination With Brian Kelly
item.itunes:title: Automation For Domination With Brian Kelly
item.description:
How often do you get in your own way? At the time, it might seem more like that doctor visit, your kid's school schedule, or some other life event stopped you from completing what you needed to…but when you look at it just a little bit closer, what was it in your brain that actually halted your progress?
 
Brian Kelly is the founder of Reach Your Peak, LLC, a company that trains entrepreneurs to stop guessing and achieve massive success at rapid speeds. He also hosts The Mind Body Business Show, where he interviews top entrepreneurs and other successful people on advice to help his audience strengthen every facet of themselves and move powerfully ahead.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Brian jam on Brian's background, why software automation is so mind-blowing, the "carpet bombing" strategy that Brian uses to help his clients saturate every platform with their message, the thrill and impact of speaking from a stage, and the incredible results that come out of seemingly small shifts in language and attitude. Listen in for an uplifting interview that will change the way you look at your circumstances (good and bad) permanently.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/brian-kelly

item.title: The Game On Creating Rocket Fuel In Your Business With Mike “C-Roc” Ciorrocco
item.itunes:title: The Game On Creating Rocket Fuel In Your Business With Mike “C-Roc” Ciorrocco
item.description:
Do your bad memories cripple you, or do they push you toward your potential at light speed? And if your answer is the first option, it's time for a reframe...specifically, one that will make you truly unstoppable.
 
Mike "C-Roc" Ciorrocco is the CEO of People Building, Inc. and the visionary brain behind the "What Are You Made Of?" movement as well as a speaker, coach, author and podcast host. He encourages his audience to use their past as fuel to light the fire that ignites their greatness.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and C-Roc jam on Clubhouse about everything from how C-Roc's background taught him to convert obstacles into rocket fuel to finding motivation to continue leveling up in spite of the events of 2020 to annihilating your goals whether you're just starting out, facing tough times or breaking into a new market - just for a start. Tune in for a history-making podcast recorded directly on Clubhouse with some of the most badass advice you'll hear in your lifetime.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/mike-ciorrocco

item.title: Nothing but the Real Shit with Terry Keevan
item.itunes:title: Nothing but the Real Shit with Terry Keevan
item.description:
When was the last time you checked yourself for tunnel vision? It's crazy common among entrepreneurs and business owners - but losing sight of anything outside of your sales and your latest ad campaign can put everything you care about at risk (including your business itself).
 
Terry Keeven, founder of St. Louis Print Co., returns to the show to drop more wisdom on entrepreneurship, keeping your other priorities in perspective, and more hard-hitting topics.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Terry dive deep on Terry's background and the value of removing yourself from your own business, horizon-expanding reading habits, why you should be hanging with people you disagree with, and working fitness and healthy eating habits into your life without letting them consume you completely. Join the guys for a conversation that goes beyond simple business advice into the core of what makes you successful, fulfilled and motivated.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/terry-keevan
 
Get More Involved:

item.content:encoded:
When was the last time you checked yourself for tunnel vision? It's crazy common among entrepreneurs and business owners - but losing sight of anything outside of your sales and your latest ad campaign can put everything you care about at risk (including your business itself).   Terry Keeven, founder of St. Louis Print Co., returns to the show to drop more wisdom on entrepreneurship, keeping your other priorities in perspective, and more hard-hitting topics.   On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Terry dive deep on Terry's background and the value of removing yourself from your own business, horizon-expanding reading habits, why you should be hanging with people you disagree with, and working fitness and healthy eating habits into your life without letting them consume you completely. Join the guys for a conversation that goes beyond simple business advice into the core of what makes you successful, fulfilled and motivated.   Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/terry-keevan   Get More Involved:

item.title: Best Kept Secrets Of Alpha Performers With Ramon Casaus
item.itunes:title: Best Kept Secrets Of Alpha Performers With Ramon Casaus
item.description:
Do you know why the things that hold you back hold you back and the things that push you forward push you forward? More importantly, do you know how to take ownership of those things to get stuff done?
 
Badass realtor and legendary entrepreneur Ramon Casaus is back to break down the facts on leadership, goal-setting, identity and so much more.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Ramon jam on the advantage you gain when you stop asking for permission and start radically accepting yourself, the vital importance of gaining clarity on what you want, what you're good at and where you're going, and the (usually underrated) value of just putting in the work. Tune in for an episode that'll make you throw on the brakes and get straight with yourself so you can move successfully forward.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/best-kept-secrets-of-alpha-performers

item.title: How to UnF**K Your Business with Tomas Keenan
item.itunes:title: How to UnF**K Your Business with Tomas Keenan
item.description:
What makes a person the person everyone else looks up to? Our mentors and idols didn’t materialize out of thin air. They got where they are with a combination of pure work ethic, hard lessons and strategic growth. Best thing you can do to get ahead? Learn their stories.
 
Tomas Keenan is an author, public speaker, high-level business coach and the host of the Step It Up Entrepreneur podcast. Through his work at Break Free Academy and his content, Tomas helps ambitious entrepreneurs and business owners make a mark on their communities and the world at large.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Tomas dig into the story of how Tomas established his legend at Break Free Academy, the “eliminate, automate, delegate” system that helps Tomas and his team get shit done like clockwork, and how to find the motivation that helps true badasses smash any and all obstacles (because they will be there). Listen in for an interview that will remove your last excuse for not succeeding the way you want to.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/tomas-keenan

item.title: How Real Leaders Lead & Develop Culture with Benito Ortiz
item.itunes:title: How Real Leaders Lead & Develop Culture with Benito Ortiz
item.description:
What makes a workplace tick? We all probably know by now that it isn’t dumbass motivational posters and snooze-worthy team meetings. What makes a team work entirely depends on the people on it and the values behind it.
 
Benito Ortiz is the founder and owner of Strategic Insurance Group and a company culture and leadership wizard. Having led teams since he was barely 21 years old, Benito throws all his insight towards making himself and his employees better, stronger, and more successful.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Benito break down the foundational pieces of successful culture within a business, including following through and sticking to your core values as a leader, striking a balance between pushing for new goals and celebrating wins, and the insane results that show up when you and your people make an actual commitment to each other. Tune in for an episode that will completely revolutionize the way you look at your team (not to mention how you lead it).
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/benito-ortiz

item.title: Play Your Game with Denis Peltier
item.itunes:title: Play Your Game with Denis Peltier
item.description:
Whose example are you following, whether in the way your run your business or the way you run your life? If your answer isn’t “mine,” now would be a good time to step back, examine who you have around you and why you operate the way you do, and rework your life to serve you.
 
Dennis Peltier is the CEO of Workforit Warriors, the host of the Workforit Warriors podcast, and a coach whose own journey to reach sobriety inspires him to motivate business owners and current addicts to get a plan in place and succeed on their own terms.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Dennis jam on Dennis' uphill battle toward sobriety, the importance of the people you keep around you, how the mental game and the action steps to go with it work together to get results, figuring out how to kick ass playing your own game, and Dennis’ next mind-blowing project. Tune in for an interview that will shatter the traditional markers of “success” that you’ve heard about and get you started building your own.
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/denis-peltier

item.title: My 6 Year Old Twin Boys Business, Dream Boards, And Entrepreneur Journey
item.itunes:title: My 6 Year Old Twin Boys Business, Dream Boards, And Entrepreneur Journey
item.description:
Are you better at business than a couple of 6 year olds? Save your answer till the end of the interview… these particular 6 year olds have big plans and the instincts (and mentorship) they need to make those plans a reality.
 
On this special episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach once again sits down with his twin sons Landon and Liam to talk about having the courage to overcome new-business nerves, visualizing goals with dream boards, and what the future holds for these young-but-sharp entrepreneurs. Listen in for an episode that will remind you not to overcomplicate the process of making goals, or what it takes to reach them.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/twin-boys-business

item.title: Christopher Lochhead - Play Bigger
item.itunes:title: Christopher Lochhead - Play Bigger
item.description:
What makes someone a success? There are as many answers to that question as there are people to answer it - but the only answer that actually matters is the one you determine (and then execute on).
 
Known as the “Godfather of Category Design,” Christopher Lochhead is also a #1 Amazon Marketing Author with multiple titles and a #1 Apple Business Podcaster. He shares insight and experience from years at the top of the entrepreneurship game with his audience and readers.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Christopher dig into the strategies behind building a kickass team as you’re starting to grow your business, the difference between being polarizing and being provocative (and growing past your biases for one ideology or another), and taking charge of your future regardless of what your past looked like. Tune in for an interview that will snap your brain out of autopilot and into its creative potential.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/christopher-lochhead

item.title: The Third Gift with J.D. McCabe
item.itunes:title: The Third Gift with J.D. McCabe
item.description:
How do you bounce back from a series of events that completely devastates your life? When you lose what you had, you are, in fact, being given a chance to start over. Would you take it?
 
J.D. McCabe’s 20-year love story warped into a nightmare with the onset of everything from his own health issues to growing mistrust between himself and his (now ex) wife to death threats and private investigators. Now, having freed himself from the turmoil, J.D. put the whole narrative down on paper in his book The Third Gift: My Dance with the Devil (And Her Mother), in the hopes that his hard-won insight and new sense of self might inspire other survivors of abuse and trauma.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, J.D. and Zach jam on the story behind the inspiration for and creation of J.D.’s book, the process of rebuilding his life and identity after having his family torn apart, and the impact he’s set on making in the lives of other traumatized and lost individuals by telling his story. Tune in for a wild ride of an interview that will leave you with a strong sense of purpose and the foundations of a fascinating tale.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/the-third-gift
 
Get More Involved:

item.title: Generate Massive Waves of Targeted Traffic to You Using SEO with Josh Rimmington
item.itunes:title: Generate Massive Waves of Targeted Traffic to You Using SEO with Josh Rimmington
item.description:
How do you make sure your brand doesn’t get lost in the sea of online entrepreneurs trying to grab attention?
 
Skip the nonsense tactics and start doubling down on your SEO - and that’s just the beginning.
 
Josh Rimmington has spent more than a decade helping small businesses get noticed and grow their following online. He serves as the director and head online marketing consultant for JR Marketing Group, as well as the host of several podcasts and a proud “dadpreneur.”
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Josh dive deep on the evolution of a career in SEO (and beyond) beginning before the Internet was really a “thing,” strategies for crushing podcast SEO specifically, and becoming a respected authority both in Google’s eyes and to your clients (present and future). Tune in to start getting your websites the hype they deserve.
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/josh-rimmington

item.title: A Tricky Mental Block That Held Me Back for Years
item.itunes:title: A Tricky Mental Block That Held Me Back for Years
item.description:
When your clients, competition and connections see you online, who are they actually seeing? The Internet makes it easy for anyone to put on a front to make more money, or to make everyone think they do. It sometimes even seems necessary. But until you get past that idea, you’re never going to see any actual success.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach digs into the biggest mental block he faced coming out of prison - specifically, the myth that he needed to build an “acceptable” image to show other people - including some hard rejections at the beginning of his story, the shit he did to try and fit in before the real growth started, and how to look past the fake “success” being sold by every phony expert on the Internet and find something real. Tune in to start seeing the value and advantage in being exactly who you are, because that person is a badass.
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/tricky-mental-block
 
Get More Involved: 
 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

item.title: Building Grit with Nick Wingo
item.itunes:title: Building Grit with Nick Wingo
item.description:
Think of the work you do every day….what does it all amount to? If you're burning to build something bigger than yourself, consider how you spend your time and energy each day. Are they spent in the service of that thing you want?
 
Nick Wingo is a firefighter, paramedic, father and host of the podcast Building Grit One Call at a Time, all dedicated to cultivating strength and a place in the world as a shining example and a help to the people around us. 
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Nick jam on Nick's career as a firefighter and how it got him charged up to make a lasting impact, the philosophy of building grit, and the way your habits as a parent shape who your kids become. Tune in to push past the bullshit tactics and start engineering true, meaningful impact.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/building-grit-with-nick-wingo

item.title: The One Thing Dictating All Of Your Actions With Bart Pietrzak
item.itunes:title: The One Thing Dictating All Of Your Actions With Bart Pietrzak
item.description:
How much of what you do in a day gets done because it’s contributing to your best lifestyle?
 
Yeah - most of us wish we could claim that kind of discipline and intention behind everything we do in our daily lives, but we fall short constantly for one reason or other. And why? Because we’re unaware of the mind-blowing rewards waiting for us once we build up the right habits.
 
A favorite guest of the show, Bart Pietrzak is back once again to lay out the philosophies and practices that make him such an incredible badass and a grade-A example of a driven, successful and 100% real human being.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Bart jam on building a highly effective lifestyle with a few very simple structures, mastering the driving motivators behind the amazing shit you’re doing each day, and figuring out the thing(s) that fire you up and fulfill you so you can double down on them and blow your goals out of the water. Tune in for a no-bullshit interview that will wake you up to the (easily fixable) things that are out of wack in your life. 
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/one-thing-dictating-all-of-your-actions
