item.title: The Agency Life, Scaling, And Perfectly Mentored With Jason Portnoy
item.itunes:title: The Agency Life, Scaling, And Perfectly Mentored With Jason Portnoy
item.description:
If 9 out of 10 small businesses fail, how do you make sure your business is the one that succeeds? There's no perfect way to run and grow your business - but there are people out there who have cultivated some strong practices you need to know about.
 
Jason Portnoy is the founder and owner of JPORT Media, an agency that helps businesses blow up their online presence and grow their exposure to refine their digital marketing strategy and attract and convert more clients.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Jason and Zach sit down together to jam on how Jason bucked tradition and fought his way through to owning a successful agency, building strategies for the long game, the shifts that put rocket fuel into Jason's podcast (and his marketing in general), and how to put your goals in context so you can reach unstoppable growth. Tune in for no-bullshit entrepreneurship advice that no one else has enough spine to tell you.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/jason-portnoy
 
Get More Involved:

item.title: Habits of Powerful Visionaries with Ramon Casaus
item.itunes:title: Habits of Powerful Visionaries with Ramon Casaus
item.description:
Do you start your day looking at other people, or looking at yourself? A lot of us begin every morning scrolling Facebook rather than getting to work on our own success. Want to show yourself that you’re serious about moving forward? Then start acting like it.
 
Ramon Casaus wasn’t in the traditional real estate game for long before he knew he wanted to do more than sell real estate forever. So, he dove headfirst into building his own empire of real estate brokers as the founder of ROC Real Estate Partners, and seeking out other badass entrepreneurs who were focused on leveling up the same way.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Ramon tackle attracting people who will push you - and themselves- to improve and succeed at high levels, how to structure your day to drown out the negative voice in your head, and rising above the temptation of the “comparison game.” Tune in to get your daily commitment to yourself and your growth rock solid.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/ramon-casaus

item.title: Charlie Walk - The One Thing That Everything Great Needs
item.itunes:title: Charlie Walk - The One Thing That Everything Great Needs
item.description:
Who’s your favorite musician? Whoever it is, today’s guest has likely worked with them. But figuring out the formula for success in any medium means doing the work to dig down past the glitz and the bright lights.
 
Charlie Walk is one of the most revered names in music industry history. Over the course of his career, Charlie has worked with artists like Shakira, Taylor Swift, Lorde and Enrique Iglesias - just to name a few. After years working for huge corporations, he broke away to create his own music mentorship program called Music Mastery.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Zach and Charlie dig into Charlie’s unconventional rise to the top as a producer, why having a team is vital for actual success (no matter who you are), the need for “human touch” in tech, and finding your individual starship. Tune in for wisdom from a man who has engineered insane amounts of success for decades. 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/charlie-walk
 
Get More Involved:

item.title: Started Off Broke AF And Now We Here
item.itunes:title: Started Off Broke AF And Now We Here
item.description:
How do you chase something everyone tells you will be impossible to catch? The answer: start goddamn running.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach lays out the path that got him where he is today, including starting the show with barely any resources, rising above the doubting voices in his head, and doing the work to become an unstoppable force. Tune in to hear the inspiring path of this show from rock bottom to rocket fuel.

item.title: Real Business Owners Get Real With Trevor Cowley And Kale Goodman
item.itunes:title: Real Business Owners Get Real With Trevor Cowley And Kale Goodman
item.description:
How many fake entrepreneurs do you see per day on Facebook and Instagram? Probably tons - because it’s much easier to slack off than to run an ethical, value-driven business. But there are those out there who are dedicated to changing the game...
 
Trevor Cowley and Kale Goodman are two of the minds behind Real Business Owners, a credit repair and accounting company that goes the extra mile past simply crunching numbers. Trevor and Kale are on a mission to do and model better practices for other entrepreneurs getting lost in the Internet bullshit.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment Show, Zach, Trevor and Kale dig into how the right culture and environment for your business takes your whole team to the next level, identifying the cracks in the system as a business grows and expands so you can strengthen those areas, and the tools you can use to attract people to your business, make sure they know, like and trust you, and serve them at the highest level possible. Tune in for real advice with real value from real business owners.
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/real-business-owners
 
Get More Involved:

item.title: Coach Burt - Activating Your Prey Drive
item.itunes:title: Coach Burt - Activating Your Prey Drive
item.description:
Want to hear a tough truth? If you’re still searching for a “why” to drive you forward, you’re wasting your time. 
 
Championship coach Micheal Burt is back on the show to lay down some wisdom about actual motivation and what a person needs to win consistently and win big.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Coach Burt break down the reality of core values and how they define effective relationships, attracting the people you need to build a rabid, unstoppable company culture, and how to activate your prey drive to pursue success both joyfully and relentlessly. Tune in to stop making excuses and make the hunt its own reward.
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/coach-burt

item.title: Michael Michalowicz - Fix This Next and Run Like Clockwork
item.itunes:title: Michael Michalowicz - Fix This Next and Run Like Clockwork
item.description:
Are you running your business? Or is your business running you? See, most of us feel like we’re on top of the world when we’re working 24/7 and completely tied into every piece of whatever we do. This is not true, and it’s not healthy.
 
Michael Michalowicz is an entrepreneur and author with bestselling business titles like Clockwork: Design Your Business to Run Itself and Fix This Next to his name (among many others). Nearly all of his work is centered on this one mission: to eradicate “entrepreneur poverty” and help the self-starters of the world build the business of their dreams without that business running them - or running them into the ground.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Michael break down the lies we have begun to believe about entrepreneurship and the “constant hustle” mentality plus how we can build our businesses up better than that, ditching the complexity in order to exponentially boost your efficiency, and why not knowing the rules of the game is your greatest advantage. Tune in for a supercharged interview that will get you headed in the right direction, wherever it is you want to go.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/michael-michalowicz
 
Get More Involved: 
 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: A Tactical Blueprint to $100k a Month Using a Low Ticket Offer with Justin Demers
item.itunes:title: A Tactical Blueprint to $100k a Month Using a Low Ticket Offer with Justin Demers
item.description:
What's your first reaction to the phrase, "low ticket"? A ton of entrepreneurs completely blow past the idea of selling a low ticket product or program - and these people have no idea what they're missing.
 
Justin Demers started his career out as an award-winning filmmaker and videographer and found a genius way to impart all that wisdom to countless entrepreneurs. He and his wife Michelle now work together to help anyone with a good idea and a decent camera blow their sales out of the water with straightforward, quality video content.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Justin and Zach jam on Justin’s mission to teach entrepreneurs how to sell with simple videos and steer people away from other BS advice, the $200K (and counting) idea behind Click Go Live and Low Ticket, High Impact, and the details of crafting your low-ticket offer into the perfect gateway for your other products. Tune in to revamp your entire perspective on that low-ticket idea you've got stashed away.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/justin-demers/
 
Get More Involved: 
 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Business Advice From a Mega Boss Under 30 - Anthony Sarandrea
item.itunes:title: Business Advice From a Mega Boss Under 30 - Anthony Sarandrea
item.description:
When did you lose sight of the thing that got you into your entrepreneurship? It happens to most of us at some point; but there's no damn excuse for lying down when it does. Get your team together, get centered and get busy.
 
Anthony Sarandrea is a legend of lead generation, as well as a wildly influential keynote speaker, philanthropist and entrepreneur. Having been featured everywhere from Forbes to Inc., Entrepreneur and beyond, Anthony continues to raise the bar for entrepreneurs the world over.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Anthony jam on the need to find the right people to keep around and figure out where those people should be placed, balancing risk and reward (not to mention you versus everyone else) when it comes to investing the dollars in your pocket, valuing the masterful shit you bring to the table correctly, and relentlessly pursuing that thing that drives and inspires you, staying dedicated to growth at all times. Tune in to reignite that spark that got you where you are today.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/anthony-sarandrea/

item.title: The Time Our Team Went to Hell and Back
item.itunes:title: The Time Our Team Went to Hell and Back
item.description:
How do you react when you hit your limits? Do you crack, back off, and get frustrated with yourself for quitting? Or do you stand up, wipe the blood off your lip and keep going? 
 
On this special episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and other students of Coach Nate Bailey give listeners a rare glimpse into what goes on at a Championship Leadership event - and break down how every one of us can learn to step up as legendary leaders and take a sledgehammer to our own limitations through radical shifts in perspective, teamwork and constant chances for victory. Tune in for a surprising take on a brutal, but ultimately transformative, challenge.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/our-team-went-to-hell/

item.title: What Is Championship Leadership with Nate Bailey
item.itunes:title: What Is Championship Leadership with Nate Bailey
item.description:
What is it that’s holding you back in life - and why haven’t you smashed through that obstacle yet? It’s not that you can’t. It’s just that you haven’t. And it’s time to figure out what’s stopping you.
 
Nate Bailey is a world-class coach, speaker, author and veteran dedicated to driving people towards their highest potential and the impact they’re striving for.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Nate returns to dive deep with Zach on the goals of Nate’s Championship Leadership events, the way leadership bleeds into every aspect of life (not just business), and earning your accolades. Listen in to level up your idea of leadership and push yourself even further.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/championship-leadership/

item.title: Seth Greene - Direct Response Marketing For the Win
item.itunes:title: Seth Greene - Direct Response Marketing For the Win
item.description:
Do you know who you are? Tons of entrepreneurs don't - and they fail because of it. So that ladder you're climbing needs to be standing on you, your skills, your value, and the people you're trying to reach with all those things.
 
Seth Greene is a legendary entrepreneur, author and master of direct response marketing. He specializes in helping other entrepreneurs grow their business through podcasting and content spanning books, social media and more. Seth himself is also a best-selling author and the co-host of the Sharkpreneur podcast.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Seth and Zach dive deep on being the guy at the top of the mountain, the process of getting clients you can actually win for, and the need to define what the point is of all this work you're doing. Tune in for real insight from someone who has actually worked his way up from nothing.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/seth-greene/

item.title: The Hustle and Flowchart with Joe Fier and Matt Wolfe
item.itunes:title: The Hustle and Flowchart with Joe Fier and Matt Wolfe
item.description:
Building something you're seriously invested in is hard enough by yourself. Trying to do so with another person is a huge risk, but if you can find the right partner, the possibilities are endless.
 
Matt Wolfe and Joe Fier founded Evergreen Profits and the Hustle and Flowchart podcast together in order to bring insanely high-level advice from legendary entrepreneurs to the masses, and they bring a unique blend of humor, actionable insight and chemistry to every episode.
 
On this episode of Underdog Empowerment, Matt and Joe of Hustle and Flowchart sit down to dive into how the two of them got connected and started building epic shit, nurturing a productive dynamic between opposite - but complementary - personalities, and the crazy perks that come with solid affiliate relationships. Tune in to reality-check the way you do business relationships.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/hustle-and-flowchart/

item.title: Grow Your Podcast Using Paid Ads with Charley Valher
item.itunes:title: Grow Your Podcast Using Paid Ads with Charley Valher
item.description:
In the current moment of short attention spans on the Internet, how do you get (and keep) your audience's attention? There are all kinds of tools and media, but choose wisely. The best strategy is one that fits perfectly with you.
 
Charley Valher went from an average career as a plumber to the elite among online advertising agencies due in part to his love of podcasts. Now, Charley hosts his own podcast, The Business of Podcasting, and continues to help entrepreneurs build stellar shows of their own through his company, Valher Media.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Charley break down the secrets of paid ads and podcasts, including unorthodox-but-effective targeting methods, choosing the ideal platform(s) for your advertising campaign, and how to avoid the most common mistakes made by rookie podcasters. Tune in to hear the marketing advice that's about to put you ahead of your peers.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/charley-valher/

item.title: Mitch Miller - Is Your Freedom Worth Dying For? Let's Find Out
item.itunes:title: Mitch Miller - Is Your Freedom Worth Dying For? Let's Find Out
item.description:
Let's get real. There's a lot of unreliable information getting thrown around online and through the media right now. So, how do you sift through the tactics and still move forward, as an individual and an entrepreneur?
 
Mitch Miller continues to spread facts, strategy and information unhindered by BS through his Father Freedom and Opposed Media brands. Today, he's back to weigh in and shed some much-needed light on the insanity going on around us and how to succeed in spite of it.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment Show, Zach and Mitch break through the misconceptions and misdirection surrounding the unrest in America, including the war between individualism and collectivism, the system people think they want versus what they're actually driving towards, how the US is being ripped apart from both the inside and outside, and the layers that go into how we form our very identities. Tune in to get past all the hazy bullshit out there and double down on some necessary truth.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/mitch-miller/
 
Get More Involved:

  3. Access Our Top Resource Recommendations: https://underdogempowerment.com/resources/
  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Tucker Max - Have You Done Your Shadow Work
item.itunes:title: Tucker Max - Have You Done Your Shadow Work
item.description:
The most impactful people on Earth are the ones who have spent the most time grappling and reckoning with themselves - and not just the pretty, shiny pieces. Those with the right mix of talent, drive and a realistic sense of self are the ones who become impossible to overlook.
 
Tucker Max is a bestselling author, speaker and the co-founder of Scribe Media, a company that helps authors-to-be pull books out of their heads and onto the page without all the tedious work and time commitment.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Tucker jam on Tucker’s accidental first client and how his business took off after, how we construct, analyze, learn from and change our personal narrative, and owning your shadow to face the shit you’ve been running from. Listen in for an interview with more wisdom than you’ll hear anywhere else this month.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/tucker-max/

item.title: The Lemonade Business That My 6 Year Old Twin Boys Built
item.itunes:title: The Lemonade Business That My 6 Year Old Twin Boys Built
item.description:
Entrepreneurship is so easy, a child could grasp it. Literally. Complicated tactics and intricate philosophies aside, it's the foundational basics that make up a lasting, successful business - and sometimes, we adults could use the reminder.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach interviews his twin boys, Liam and Landon, on their booming lemonade stand business, the lessons they've learned about saving and investing money, and how each boy found his role on the operations side. Listen in for some heartwarming, incredibly insightful moments from two young entrepreneurs.
 
Shownotes: https://underdogempowerment.com/lemonade-business/

item.title: Habits of a World Series Championship with Dana Cavalea
item.itunes:title: Habits of a World Series Championship with Dana Cavalea
item.description:
When you think of your favorite athlete, what qualities come to mind - maybe strength, drive or grit? Not everyone reaches star status, but those who do bring a rare set of traits to the table.
 
Coach Dana Cavalea is an award-winning coach whose career began as the Director of Strength & Conditioning and Performance for the New York Yankees. His skills in coaching and leadership led him to branch out and lend his insight to CEOs entrepreneurs and other professionals. Coach Dana is also the author of Habits of a Champion and several other motivational books for children alongside his work as a speaker.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Dana take a deep dive into knowing what to quit and when, the combination of talent and hunger that creates a legend, how real, lasting relationships form, and dropping the insecurity to move towards that thing that holds your passion. Tune in for gems from the man behind some of the all-time greatest athletes.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/dana-cavalea/
 
Get More Involved: 
 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Andy Frisella Real AF On Life and Business
item.itunes:title: Andy Frisella Real AF On Life and Business
item.description:
Fact is, most business owners and entrepreneurs quit within a few years because they can't take the heat. Only a select few have figured out how to push forward, turn their weaknesses into superpowers and continue to level up decades down the line…
 
Andy Frisella is back to give us more hard-earned insight from his years spent building up crazy customer loyalty, setting the bar for entrepreneurs and teaching others how to do the same.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Andy dig into the strategy behind going all in (the smart way) and playing the long game, translating pain into radical growth in your own way, and the real problems messing up our country right now - the ones a lot of people don't want to see. Listen in for stone-cold facts from a man with decades behind him to back up the wisdom.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/real-af/

item.title: Zayde Wølf the Rock Artist - Music Business & Internet Marketing
item.itunes:title: Zayde Wølf the Rock Artist - Music Business & Internet Marketing
item.description:
Great music tells a story. Exceptional music tells you who the artist is. More than just a creative brain, it takes sharp business instincts, plenty of support and a hell of a lot of persistence to make your mark as a musician.
 
Dustin Burnett - or Zayde Wolf, as the music industry knows him - took a usual route to writing, producing and playing, right up until he leaned into an improvised alter ego and the right person recognized his incredible talent and licensed his song. From there, Dustin has continued to skyrocket in the indie pop scene and license his music for everything from TV shows to video games, international ads and more. No matter the project, Dustin's creativity, drive and innovative spirit saturate every note.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Dustin and Zach get into the birth of Zayde Wolf, the key to making good money off the music you create, and how important life experiences translate into the hardest-hitting, most impactful music. Listen in for a rare look behind the curtain of a badass artist.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/zayde-wolf/

item.title: Why You Can’t Start with WHY
item.itunes:title: Why You Can’t Start with WHY
item.description:
You've probably read or heard somewhere that you have to know your "why" in order to succeed. Now let's talk about why that's bullshit.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach digs into getting clear on "who" before you figure out "why," the steps to making a permanent identity shift, and what discipline has to do with it all. Tune in for insight that will change your whole damn life.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/cant-start-with-why/

item.title: Futuristic the Rapper - Still on the Rise
item.itunes:title: Futuristic the Rapper - Still on the Rise
item.description:
Fame is rarely glamorous. Not every artist with a big following has had their career handed to them on a silver platter. There are those who fought for every step, pulling themselves ahead of the pack and changing their corner of the industry forever.
 
Futuristic is a household name at this point. Like most others, though, he didn’t start out that way. He grew up simply working hard, immersing himself in music and learning how to run a business with integrity and accountability. Now, as a mature artist with his star rising, Futuristic continues to pump out chart-topping hits like "Pull Up" and "The Greatest" amassing millions of loyal followers and constantly playing with different genres and styles.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Futuristic jam on the importance of embracing the “business” part of the music business, attracting the people that align with who you are, and finding ways to stay hungry and motivated even when you’ve reached the top. Tune in to get to know the man behind the legendary music. 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/futuristic/

item.title: Why Finding Your WHY Isn’t As Important As They Say with Tyler Jack Harris
item.itunes:title: Why Finding Your WHY Isn’t As Important As They Say with Tyler Jack Harris
item.description:
We live in a results-oriented culture, as far as entrepreneurship is concerned. Everyone wants to show off the accolades and the big wins, but there are very few who really dedicate themselves to documenting the journey and using the knowledge they’ve actually earned to move ahead.
 
If life is built like a roller coaster, Tyler Jack Harris was going nowhere but up - right up until he topped that hill and went straight down. But even at his worst point, Tyler realized that playing the victim was getting him nowhere. He pulled himself back up, and today he is the founder and host of several podcasts and vlogs, and one of the highest earners for and owners of the life insurance company that made his transformation possible.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Tyler get into the power you gain when you wage war with yourself and take responsibility for your life, why knowing who you are should be your priority, how to only promise what you can deliver on, and how the path towards fulfillment - and success, for that matter - begins when you focus on what you’re passionate about. Join the conversation for a dose of inspiration, insight, and hard-hitting truth.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/tyler-jack-harris/

item.title: David Meltzer - Preparing For and Executing the Different Levels of Entrepreneurship
item.itunes:title: David Meltzer - Preparing For and Executing the Different Levels of Entrepreneurship
item.description:
In a society that so often encourages people to focus inward and look out for number one, the rarest individuals are those who strive to inspire others without sacrificing themselves in the process.
 
David Meltzer continues to crush his life goal of making as many people happy as possible, and today he returns to spit some more wisdom from his experience as a speaker, author, entrepreneur and the co-founder of Sports 1 Marketing.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, David and Zach break down what it means to stay inspired and worthy of your accomplishments, building an all-star team that complements your skills, and how the universe responds when you keep your promises. Listen in for solid advice that will uplift you for days.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/preparing-for-and-executing/

item.title: Billy Gene Is Marketing - Why You Suck At Being Polarizing
item.itunes:title: Billy Gene Is Marketing - Why You Suck At Being Polarizing
item.description:
There’s a lot of opinions on the Internet. No brainer. In fact, they’re inescapable. So, how do you know who’s just spitting out whatever they think will get people’s attention and who actually knows something? For that, we turn to the best.
 
Billy Gene of Billy Gene Is Marketing returns to the show today to check back in, talk about what he’s learned since the last time, drop some wisdom and nothing but the truth, and let us know what he’s got in store with his new podcast, Billy Gene Is Marketing Offends the Internet.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Billy dig into what being polarizing actually means, as well as what it doesn’t, why clarity is the key factor for a killer offer, and how much faster success comes if you know exactly what you can do (and you put the actual work in). Listen in to once again hear from a legend.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/billy-gene/

item.title: George Floyd, White Privilege, Black Privilege, Double Standards, and Dick Pics
item.itunes:title: George Floyd, White Privilege, Black Privilege, Double Standards, and Dick Pics
item.description:
There’s a lot of opinions flying back and forth right now. And usually, for every opinion, there is a reaction. And at the moment, a lot of us are reacting without thinking it through first. So let’s just take a second to have an actual dialogue (one in which we don’t have to agree) and talk about the issue, not our feelings.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach shares a clip from his recent appearance on DoubleB Creates’s podcast where he, Brad and Kevin jammed on the media coverage and popular attitudes surrounding George Floyd’s death, how men and women communicate and relate to each other sexually, and some parting words from Zach on how he plans to teach motivated motherfuckers to fish for a lifetime. Listen in to pull back the curtain on the chaos we’re all reading about right now.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/george-floyd/

item.title: Les Brown - Why You’ve Got to Be Hungry If You Want to Win
item.itunes:title: Les Brown - Why You’ve Got to Be Hungry If You Want to Win
item.description:
The world is an overwhelming place, and it's easy to let the worst parts of it bury you - but the moment you can recognize and harness your ability to shape your own mind and your way through life, there won't be a single thing on Earth that can stop you.
 
Les Brown walked a hard road to be who he is today - but he knows well that he had angels to help him along, from the women in his life to his children and his mentors. Now, Les shares the wisdom he has gathered over a lifetime and across the world as a speaker, award-winning DJ, author and trainer, and helps his audiences conquer complacency and adversity to achieve extraordinary things.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Les and Zach dig deep into the power we have over our minds as well as how to use it for good, the ways our lives change through purpose, belief in ourselves and the help of the people around us, and the four questions you can ask yourself to start down the path to your destiny. Listen in for life-changing inspiration, power and peace of mind.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/les-brown/

item.title: Bedros Keuilian - The Privilege of being Underprivileged
item.itunes:title: Bedros Keuilian - The Privilege of being Underprivileged
item.description:
Everybody's playing small these days. Taking the easy path, using scammy tactics, generally running on bullshit. That's generally the approach of someone who has no interest in working hard or getting passionate about what they do. The secret? Those things are the starting point of a life you haven't even imagined yet.
 
Bedros Keuilian’s story started as an uphill battle. Even after his family escaped communism in Armenia, he faced extreme poverty, violence and bullying from those around him. The adversity lit a fire in Bedros, and he buckled down and got to work. Now, Bedros has multi-million dollar companies across multiple industries to his name and continues to grow as an author, speaker, the CEO of Fit Body Boot Camp and co-host of the Empire Show.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Bedros talk truth about the upside-down ideas we have about privilege, the art of staying blissfully dissatisfied, why verifying the people around you matters, and building confidence by racking up wins one by one. Join the conversation for the reality check you need to blow past your limits.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/bedros-keuilian/
 
Get More Involved: 
 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

item.content:encoded:
Everybody's playing small these days. Taking the easy path, using scammy tactics, generally running on bullshit. That's generally the approach of someone who has no interest in working hard or getting passionate about what they do. The secret? Those things are the starting point of a life you haven't even imagined yet.   Bedros Keuilian’s story started as an uphill battle. Even after his family escaped communism in Armenia, he faced extreme poverty, violence and bullying from those around him. The adversity lit a fire in Bedros, and he buckled down and got to work. Now, Bedros has multi-million dollar companies across multiple industries to his name and continues to grow as an author, speaker, the CEO of Fit Body Boot Camp and co-host of the Empire Show.   On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Bedros talk truth about the upside-down ideas we have about privilege, the art of staying blissfully dissatisfied, why verifying the people around you matters, and building confidence by racking up wins one by one. Join the conversation for the reality check you need to blow past your limits.   Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/bedros-keuilian/   Get More Involved:

item.title: Grant Cardone - Why and When You Gotta Kill It Off
item.itunes:title: Grant Cardone - Why and When You Gotta Kill It Off
item.description:
It’s easier than ever to find an excuse for not succeeding, between coronavirus and its impact on the economy. But if you’re curling into a ball to hide right now, that’s on no one but you. And rather than waste your potential, put that energy towards finding a way to show up better right now and every day after.
 
Grant Cardone is the definition of the boss, in everything he does. His accomplishments speak for themselves, from topping marketing lists at Forbes to his billion-dollar real estate portfolio and multiple best-selling business and entrepreneurship programs. Today he returns to the show to drop some wisdom on handling your shit no matter what goes on around you.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Grant jam on reinventing yourself during crises and disruptions, getting past “survival mode” to aim higher, and why you sometimes have to kill a project or pursuit to move ahead. Join the conversation to leave the COVID-19 anxiety behind and come out on top.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/10x/

item.title: You’ll Never Keep Clients If You Don’t Get This Right with Tony Banta - The Client Whisperer
item.itunes:title: You’ll Never Keep Clients If You Don’t Get This Right with Tony Banta - The Client Whisperer
item.description:
What's your entrepreneurial skill set? Are you a technician, or more of a visionary? No matter which category you fall into, you can't help your people if you can't lead them well.
 
Tony Banta knows what very few of us can really see: everything in life is a system. And it's that knowledge, along with a few other unique ingredients, that have earned him the title of The Client Whisperer. Along with his wife Suzanne, Tony helps service-based businesses refine their leadership component to provide value on an entirely new level.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Tony and Zach trade insights on the vital importance of taking ownership as a leader, why clients leave your service (and what you can do to prevent that), and how to access the literal roadmap for successfully leading even the toughest clients. Listen in to give your people more than just the latest systems.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/tony-banta/

item.title: What’s More Powerful Than Marketing with The Marketing Geeks
item.itunes:title: What’s More Powerful Than Marketing with The Marketing Geeks
item.description:
Entrepreneurship is born out of creativity, drive and an optimistic mind….ideally. But you could probably think of someone you know who takes it all a little too seriously. Here's the secret: endless opportunities wait for those who can balance discipline with a little joy.
 
Justin and Andros - also known as The Marketing Geeks - have moved themselves forward in life and business with the words, "Sure, we can do that." Their podcast was born the same way, and has attracted a massive, devoted fan base who show up for marketing advice, psychology, and thoughts on superhero movies.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach sits down with Justin and Andros to dive into carving out your own niche in podcasting, what Black Sabbath can teach us about productivity, and imagining a collaborative future. Tune in for high energy and some (semi) serious wisdom.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/marketing-geeks/

item.title: Getting This Right Makes Business Easy with Mike Szczesniak
item.itunes:title: Getting This Right Makes Business Easy with Mike Szczesniak
item.description:
Think of a high performer, that top achiever you look up to and study. Who came to mind? The thing is, we all know of someone like that. But did you know that all that power comes from just a few simple building blocks?
 
Mike Szczesniak was living the dream, with a high-powered corporate job and all its perks - right up until he began suffering panic attacks anytime he stopped working. After a serious re-evaluation of his priorities, mindset and view of productivity, Mike began teaching others, and he now hosts The Results Engine Podcast, which is geared towards millennials and entrepreneurs seeking high-performance habits.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Mike dive into the thought process behind optimizing your life in order to invest in yourself, cultivating flexibility and habits that can bend and travel with you - plus some incredible fitness tips, and the five pieces Mike focuses on with his clients to turn ordinary entrepreneurs into high-performance powerhouses. Listen in for the energy boost your day needs.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/makes-business-easy/

item.title: How to Crush It with Your Finances Even If You Suck - Kc Chohan
item.itunes:title: How to Crush It with Your Finances Even If You Suck - Kc Chohan
item.description:
Entrepreneurs all have big dreams and bigger plans. Unfortunately, those plans frequently fall through because a visionary isn’t enough to sustain a growing company. Want to reach the next level? You’re going to need help.
 
KC Chohan started out on a fairly traditional route through the world of finance. He got a useful degree, went on to find good work as an accountant, climbed the ranks of the Fortune 500 - and then realized it just wasn’t for him. So he set his sights on helping smaller businesses to grow and make a big impact. Now, KC runs TogetherCFO, a company that helps business owners spot the gaps and fill them to get ahead.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, KC and Zach jam on the vital role that financial expertise plays in bringing balance to every business, how to decide where your focus goes as a business owner, and how KC and his team prove their value to each client in order to build strong, lasting relationships. Join the conversation to bring a whole new dimension to the way you do business.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/kc-chohan/

  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: The Difference Between Real and Fake Entrepreneurs Exposed
item.itunes:title: The Difference Between Real and Fake Entrepreneurs Exposed
item.description:
It never fails. A crisis happens, and suddenly, everyone with a shaky foundation to their business - you know, the ones who weren't prepared - starts giving out bad advice just to stay afloat. How can you tell the difference? There's a few key factors you need to be checking out. 
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment Podcast, Zach digs into some of the major pivots he's made over his lifetime, the core values, planning and strategies that real entrepreneurs use to get through good times and bad, and the mistakes fake "experts" make that sink the ship when hardship hits. Stay tuned for some clarity in the middle of all this fake Facebook expertise.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/fake-entrepreneurs-exposed/

item.title: Dan Fleyshman - Youngest Founder of a Publicly Traded Company
item.itunes:title: Dan Fleyshman - Youngest Founder of a Publicly Traded Company
item.description:
In spite of all the shortcuts and gadgets available to us today, there's still no substitute for a willingness to learn and to just do the work. And if you can do those couple of simple things, the possibilities - and your ability to change the world - become endless.
 
Even after all his success, Dan Fleyshman is no stranger to straight-up hustle. From selling baseball cards as a kid to making millions as the youngest person to found a publicly-traded company, Dan's foundation of working hard and staying hungry remains. These days, he is an angel investor for multiple companies and hosts free "elevator nights" for entrepreneurs. Dan is also the founder of the Model Citizen Fund, an organization that provides essential supplies to the homeless.
 
Kicking off the third season of the Underdog Empowerment Podcast, Zach and Dan sit down together to jam on the perspective that keeps your hunger alive, the groundwork Dan had to do to get his energy drinks in stores (plus the reason he never heard the word “no”), and why the Model Citizen Fund was built to be replicated. Listen in for some real, down-to-earth wisdom.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/dan-fleyshman/
 
Get More Involved: 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178
  2. Access Our Top Resource Recommendations: https://underdogempowerment.com/resources/
  3. Join The Elite Underdog Alphas With The Free Underdog Report: https://underdogempowerment.com/report
  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Why Fake Entrepreneurs Fail and What I Learned From One
item.itunes:title: Why Fake Entrepreneurs Fail and What I Learned From One
item.description:
When you do good work, there are people out there who will admire what you do - and then there are others who would rather steal it.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach discusses a recent situation involving plagiarism, how it was handled (versus how it should have been) and what it takes to claim actual mastery of a skill. Listen in for some secondhand lessons that'll save you a few headaches.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/why-entrepreneurs-fail/

item.title: High Ticket Talk with Russ Ruffino
item.itunes:title: High Ticket Talk with Russ Ruffino
item.description:
Running a business seems complicated. Whether you’re a one-man-show or the guy in charge of an entire team, it’s easy to lose sight of the reason your business exists: to serve your people, and serve them to the best of your ability.
 
Russ Ruffino built Clients on Demand from a desire to do more than just release content that keeps the audience happy but doesn’t inspire action. Once he put his focus on premium offers built to meet his clients’ needs, everything changed. Russ now pours his experience into others who are looking to follow in his footsteps. 
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Russ jam on the formula that separates legit entrepreneurs from scammy online “experts”, building a business that functions like a machine - one that you actually understand - to get you where you want to go, and how keeping your integrity as you grow gets you 90% of the way to the success you’re after. Listen in for the tools you need to set your business apart from the rest.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/russ-ruffino/

  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

item.title: Are You Suffering From the Information Gap?
item.itunes:title: Are You Suffering From the Information Gap?
item.description:
No one knows everything, and a lot of people know almost nothing. That’s why self-education is super important if you’re an entrepreneur trying to succeed at whatever it is you’re doing. But beware self-educating so much that it cripples your ability to take action.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment Show, Zach gets into the information gap that  a lot of entrepreneurs face, how it happens, and how to push past it so you can really accomplish what you set out to accomplish. Stay tuned to figure out how to learn by doing.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/information-gap/

item.title: UGG Boots Brian Smith and the Inside Look
item.itunes:title: UGG Boots Brian Smith and the Inside Look
item.description:
The road to glory is never actually glorious, and those who would tell you otherwise probably never achieved much to begin with. The real legends tell the stories of their mistakes and the lessons that came from those missteps, and they know that the rough moments are where success is born.
 
As a young guy dreaming of entrepreneurship, Brian Smith chased his ambitions from Australia to California. What started with six pairs of boots eventually became Ugg, a household name and billion-dollar brand. Now, with decades of lessons, mistakes and wisdom in hand, Brian spends his time speaking, teaching and sharing his insight with others who aspire to a legacy like his.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Brian and Zach dive into the process of giving birth to and raising an idea, how to build a brand and solidify some actual credibility, and why ignorance can be your biggest assets as an entrepreneur. Stick around to learn from the story of a true empire.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/ugg-boots-brian-smith/

Get More Involved:

1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

3. Access Our Top Resource Recommendations: https://underdogempowerment.com/resources/
4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: John Bourgeois - The Dreamcatchers Show
item.itunes:title: John Bourgeois - The Dreamcatchers Show
item.description:
Goals are great - until they’re not. Fact is, if you’re spending more time dreaming than you are doing, it’s time to switch up your approach and start making some progress.
 
John Bourgeois founded the Dreamcatcher Show to connect with people who are, simply, crushing it in their own personal arenas. The point is to dissect real, no-BS success so listeners can stop reaching for what they want and just go get it.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and John jam on learning from mistakes and constructive criticism, why confidence is essential to succeeding at literally anything (and why humility is overrated), and the actual definition of what we call “selflessness.” Join in to bypass the information overload on the Internet and figure out how to get where you want to go.

Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/john-bourgeois/

item.title: Ryan Stewman - The G Code & Random Stuff
item.itunes:title: Ryan Stewman - The G Code & Random Stuff
item.description:
We are a society that likes appearances. Whether it's a sleek sports car, a fair government or even a fake-prosperous business, we're given a lot of heightened 'reality'. That being the case, it takes a little common sense and a lot of drive to push past the bullshit and continue moving forward, whatever that means to you.
 
Ryan Stewman is a third-time visitor to the podcast because he completely embodies the underdog spirit. Between success in entrepreneurship, stays in prison and self-education during both, Ryan has a world of wisdom, insight and strategy to give to those he teaches through Hardcore Closer.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Ryan sit down once again to jam on what's going on behind the scenes in the American prison system, doing their part to give ex-cons a strong future and lower the recidivism rate, and recognizing our natural tendency towards snap judgment in order to co-exist with and learn from those around us. Jump in and get the realest (and best) advice you'll hear anywhere.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/g-code/

Get More Involved:

1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

3. Access Our Top Resource Recommendations: https://underdogempowerment.com/resources/
4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Tiffany Toombs - Take The Leap
item.itunes:title: Tiffany Toombs - Take The Leap
item.description:
Those who heal from trauma often become the strongest and most motivated among us. But their success doesn't come from grit alone. It takes a catalyst followed by a clear "why" and a close relationship with your own brain.
 
If not for one singular, life-impacting moment, Tiffany Toombs would not be with us today. After experiencing a series of horrific events and then a hard jolt to her mindset, Tiffany set about moving forward from her pain to help others heal in the ways that she had. Currently, Tiffany serves as the founder and driving force behind Blue Lotus Mind, which provides resources for deep psychological healing to those with a past filled with pain, and the Take the Leap! podcast.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Tiffany get into Tiffany's one-of-a-kind story, identifying and accessing what drives you personally (then facing your beliefs to effect real change) and how the podcast is making an impact with healthy programming, one mind at a time. Join the conversation to harness your brain power.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/tiffany-toombs/

item.title: Patrick Bet-David - The Hustle It Takes to Build A Company Like Valuetainment
item.itunes:title: Patrick Bet-David - The Hustle It Takes to Build A Company Like Valuetainment
item.description:
Forget "inspiration". What makes you hungry? What is it that makes you feel unstoppable, willing to work through anything to get to the goal? Once you find it, no advantage belonging to someone else can compete with what you bring to the table.
 
Patrick Bet-David shouldn't be where he is now, if the world had had a say. His path has led him from a refugee camp to the military and then the peak of entrepreneurial achievement running Valuetainment. Patrick has, all his life, taken every obstacle in his way and removed it - and he is committed to teaching others to do the same.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Patrick jam on the reasons why you need clarity and vision before you put systems in your business, what motivates Patrick to move aggressively forward (as well as how you can unlock your own driving force), and how each generation succeeds on the shoulders of the ones before, one way or another. Listen in to learn from a man who uses his brain and his will to put himself exactly where he needs to be.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/patrick-bet-david/

item.title: Coronavirus and Soft Ass Entrepreneurs
item.itunes:title: Coronavirus and Soft Ass Entrepreneurs
item.description:
Let's be real. We're going through it right now. It seems like COVID-19 is bleeding into every part of our lives, and entrepreneurs in particular are feeling the pain - some more than others. But at the end of the day, we control how we react to every situation. So, how are you handling this crisis?
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach tackles the Coronavirus problem head-on, addresses the way entrepreneurs are currently reacting to it (and how they could be doing it better), and lays down some tough truth on the attitude you need in order to survive when the unexpected goes down. Listen in to get ahead of those still frozen in fear.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/coronavirus/

item.title: Alex Morton - Let’s Talk About Network Marketing
item.itunes:title: Alex Morton - Let’s Talk About Network Marketing
item.description:
What comes to your mind when you hear the words, "network marketing"? If you scoff and think about pyramid schemes, it's time to re-evaluate the examples you've been given. Just like in any other industry, the ones who succeed are the least glamorous - but they've put in the work.
 
Alex Morton grew up wanting the lifestyles he saw the elite around him living - and he simply went out and got it, through books and an open attitude and plain, driven hard work. Nearly a decade and $30 million later, Alex continues to educate his audiences with wisdom for growth that comes from having done it all himself.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Alex dive deep on the misconceptions that fuel the stigma against network marketing, the importance of building a personal brand, and why the right mindset is the key to your success. Join the conversation to shift your mindset beyond what seems possible.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/alex-morton/
 
Get More Involved: 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

item.title: Nic Peterson - Set the Game Up to Win
item.itunes:title: Nic Peterson - Set the Game Up to Win
item.description:
Of all the sexy marketing tactics and “life hacks” out there that promise to work like a charm, how many can back up the claim? In fact, just like anything else you build up brick by brick, the exceptional business and the life you’re looking for start with some self-awareness, a discerning eye for the people around you, and intentional, consistent lifestyle tweaks that work.
 
Nic Peterson is a perfect example. Having spent years of his life homeless, but with a relentless hunger for learning, Nic found a way to combine his skills in fitness with the things he was being taught by those around him, and went on to build and grow multiple (incredibly successful) businesses based on a desire to connect with and learn from the best around. These days, Nic helps entrepreneurs and business owners grow, scale, and connect with others while staying aligned with who they are.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Nic get into the value of working with clients who practice what they preach, the simple secret behind creating massive change in your life (and helping those you serve do it too), and why you shouldn’t be worried when someone rips off your work. Listen in to set the game up your own way.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/nic-peterson/
 
Get More Involved: 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178
  2. Access Our Top Resource Recommendations: https://underdogempowerment.com/resources/
  3. Join The Elite Underdog Alphas With The Free Underdog Report: https://underdogempowerment.com/report
  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Chris Ducker - Upgrade Your Freedom and Bank Account
item.itunes:title: Chris Ducker - Upgrade Your Freedom and Bank Account
item.description:
A strong personal presence is the lifeblood of the entrepreneur's work. How you show up determines who you attract, what others say about you when you're not around, and how able you'll be to move smoothly from one business venture to the next. So, how much attention are you paying to your personal branding?
 
Chris Ducker has been scratching the entrepreneurial itch since his teen years. A self-proclaimed "sales and marketing guy" with years of experience under his belt, Chris now lends his talents and his insight to his career as a speaker, author, coach, and founder of Youpreneur, which exists to help entrepreneurs zero in on the best personal branding for them.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Chris dive deep on the staying power of well-developed personal branding, the 3 Lists to Freedom exercise (as well as the resulting impact) and strategies for staying present and keeping family at the top of the priority list. Keep listening to hone in on the value you bring to the table.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/chris-ducker/
 
Get More Involved: 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178

item.title: Nate Bailey - Championship Leadership
item.itunes:title: Nate Bailey - Championship Leadership
item.description:
Who’s the most impressive person you can think of? It might be an athlete, a millionaire entrepreneur, or some other industry giant with a crazy achievement under their belt. Huge wins like that can seem really far off from where you stand. But did you ever stop to think about how they got there?
 
Nate Bailey has always looked up to the storytellers - leaders who share their wisdom and teach others what it takes to succeed. Now, after a lifetime of overcoming obstacles - including a hard recovery from military deployment, 2 failed attempts at a 100-mile run and getting a podcast off the ground, Nate continues to coach and inspire men and women to make a real impact with discipline and a relentless mindset.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Nate and Zach break down the realities of struggling before you hit your momentum, being a person of your word and keeping your commitments (even to yourself), and the un-sexy truth behind being a legend.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/nate-bailey/

item.title: Evan Carmichael - Building an Audience of Over 2M
item.itunes:title: Evan Carmichael - Building an Audience of Over 2M
item.description:
What makes you happy? Do you find fulfillment in others or within yourself? If you’re not sure (or not happy) - it’s time to find out.
 
Evan Carmichael has conquered everything from venture capitalism to salsa dancing, and he knows that the key to it all is to #Believe. Now, he works towards solving the world’s greatest problem - the absence of belief in ourselves and what we have to offer - while encouraging the entrepreneurs in his audience of 2 million on YouTube. Evan is also the author of Built to Serve, his latest book on finding real purpose.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Evan jam on the reasons that sharing your story is the best thing you can do for your audience, how the game changes when you tie yourself to the effort, not the result, and why humans are hard-wired to serve each other. Tune in to start believing.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/evan-carmichael/

item.title: How to Build and Sell an Online Course Reverse Engineered
item.itunes:title: How to Build and Sell an Online Course Reverse Engineered
item.description:
If you're starting from 0, building an online course sounds complicated, but forget the fancy metrics and the so-called experts. The best programs are put together by people who have done the work, gotten their hands dirty, and figured it out for themselves.
 
This episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast busts open the process of building a successful online course, as Zach lays out his proven ground-up approach, explains why the "gurus" of the internet marketing world are doing it wrong, and touches on the importance of feeling ripped off - by yourself - at the start.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/sell-an-online-course/

item.title: Kevin Martin - Lead Singer of Candlebox
item.itunes:title: Kevin Martin - Lead Singer of Candlebox
item.description:
We typically think about the life of a rockstar as the perfect gig - but a lot more goes into that lifestyle than just making music, and those who make it to the top know a thing or two about building a brand from the ground up.
 
Kevin Martin grew up knowing that he wanted to play music for the rest of his life, and he became one of the founding members of the band Candlebox in 1990. The road from there wasn’t easy, but through plain hard work and plenty of struggle, Candlebox went on to produce world-changing music, including one record that sold over 400 million copies. Kevin and the band are still active, and his momentum has continued as Candlebox prepares for another tour in the spring of 2020.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Kevin lay down wisdom on the similarities between running a band and running a business, the responsibility we all have to recognize dishonesty and pursue truth, and doing the legwork necessary to succeed in the long term.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/kevin-martin/

  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Bobby Stocks - 7 Figure Mindset
item.itunes:title: Bobby Stocks - 7 Figure Mindset
item.description:
Entrepreneurship is scary. It is the step into the unknown that not everyone is willing to take. And to take that road to the very top, you’re going to need more than just grit. 
 
Bobby Stocks is back to shed some more light on his own path from the depths of drug addiction to a successful, fulfilling lifestyle running 6- and 7-figure businesses, and to highlight the individual strategies, mindset pieces and reminders that got him there.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Bobby and Zach break down how Bobby went from drug-addicted convicted felon to elite business strategist - and what drove him forward through the whole journey, the process of overcoming growth-inhibiting fear, and the importance of fact-based decision making (because you’re doing better than you think you are). Listen in to learn how to crush your fears and keep moving forward.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/7-figure-mindset/

item.title: John Lee Dumas - Entrepreneurs on Fire
item.itunes:title: John Lee Dumas - Entrepreneurs on Fire
item.description:
Although our culture is full of enticing shortcuts and get-rich-quick ideas, the most successful among us know that the only solid path forward is by doing the work and gaining knowledge as you go.
 
John Lee Dumas is a legend in the entrepreneurial space. After pursuing careers from the Army to law school to commercial real estate, JLD realized the solution to his insatiable need to learn: podcasting. Now, having interviewed over 2,000 of the brightest minds out there, John continues to build the Entrepreneurs on Fire podcast in order to share his love of learning with his listeners.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and John jam on the value of doing one thing thousands of times, the audience feedback questions that guarantee you a win (on and off the air), and his hopes and strategies for growing in the future. Listen in for unforgettable insights from the very best.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/entrepreneurs-on-fire/

item.title: Brian Kurtz - Overdeliver with Direct Response Marketing
item.itunes:title: Brian Kurtz - Overdeliver with Direct Response Marketing
item.description:
What are the principles that drive the way you market? “Shiny Object Syndrome” is a constant temptation for entrepreneurs and business owners, but every truly successful giant in marketing knows the value of getting back to basics.
 
Brian Kurtz is a legend in the world of direct response marketing. After spending decades helping an elite publishing company reach the 9-figure mark, Brian threw himself even further into his love of direct marketing. He wrote Overdeliver, which remains a staple of the industry, and he continues to teach others the foundational principles of passionate, effective marketing while embracing innovation.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Brian and Zach break down the holy grail of lifetime value, which three factors of your direct marketing will put you on the path to success, and why your business lives and dies by your list. Join the conversation and give your business an instant advantage.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/brian-kurtz/

item.title: Rory F Stern - Direct Response Marketing
item.itunes:title: Rory F Stern - Direct Response Marketing
item.description:
How do you reach the people you’re trying to speak to, and how well is it working? It can be tough to sift through the nonsense and misinformation surrounding paid traffic and its various platforms - thankfully, all it takes is an ounce of discernment.
 
Rory Stern went from stay-at-home dad to paid traffic code-cracker after seeing the chaos and frustration felt by countless small business owners. Now, he helps business owners and entrepreneurs master direct response marketing while giving actual value and staying away from empty fads.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Rory unearth the secret behind motivating your audience to take some action, the moving parts of the platforms we use to run traffic, and the vital importance of gathering data before making moves. Listen in to change the game in your own business.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/rory-f-stern/

item.title: Marian V Esanu Takes Over the Mic Today
item.itunes:title: Marian V Esanu Takes Over the Mic Today
item.description:
We, as people, have a chronic fear of public speaking, and yet, we are addicted to podcasting. Everyone has a message they want to be heard, so how do you raise your voice above the noise - especially if you’re starting with nothing?
 
Marian V Esanu is the perfect example of the hustle and hunger that make up the American dream. From anonymous immigrant to 7-figure entrepreneur, he embodies what it means to build success one brick at a time. These days, Marian coaches others on attracting and acquiring high-end clients in their business through his program and the High End Client Acquisition podcast. 
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Marian hijacks the mic to talk with Zach about how to grow a podcast from nothing, how to get A-list guests for interviews, and how to rank your show high without ruining your relationships. Want to know how a podcast stands out from the crowd? Listen in.
 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/marian-v-esanu/

item.title: Rock Thomas - Farm Boy to Self-Made Millionaire
item.itunes:title: Rock Thomas - Farm Boy to Self-Made Millionaire
item.description:
How much control do you exercise over your own story? Do you walk through the world being empowered and inspired by those around you, or do you try to stumble through on your own strength? 
 
Few people come from more humble beginnings than Rock Thomas. Rock grew up on a farm in Canada, learning how to do the difficult things to make life easy. Since then, he has overcome the unhealthy narrative he used to know and, these days, devotes his time to teaching others how to do the same through the I Am Movement podcast.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Rock jam on the process of changing your personal narrative, how to humble yourself to access the wisdom of others, and the importance of a strong personal development plan. Listen in for powerful insight and uplifting inspiration. 
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/rock-thomas/

item.content:encoded:
How much control do you exercise over your own story? Do you walk through the world being empowered and inspired by those around you, or do you try to stumble through on your own strength?    Few people come from more humble beginnings than Rock Thomas. Rock grew up on a farm in Canada, learning how to do the difficult things to make life easy. Since then, he has overcome the unhealthy narrative he used to know and, these days, devotes his time to teaching others how to do the same through the I Am Movement podcast.   On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zach and Rock jam on the process of changing your personal narrative, how to humble yourself to access the wisdom of others, and the importance of a strong personal development plan. Listen in for powerful insight and uplifting inspiration.    Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/rock-thomas/   Get More Involved:

item.title: John Rowley - ClickBank Living Legend
item.itunes:title: John Rowley - ClickBank Living Legend
item.description:
All the people in the world who are truly worth learning from have traveled from the lowest depths to incredible highs - and there’s no better example than John Rowley. From a lowly job as a janitor to making millions on Clickbank, John’s story is one of extraordinary growth, defeat, and even greater success in the wake of disaster.
 
These days, John Rowley helps others reach and maintain peak physical performance and craft a sustainably healthy lifestyle. He is also the author of several bestselling books, including the wildly successful Old School New Body, and he remains one of the best minds in the fitness, nutrition and personal development industries.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment Podcast, Zach and John break down the value of self-education and plain old initiative, why slowing down can make you more successful, and why you have to be willing to do the little stuff. No matter where your story stands, it isn’t over. Listen in to move forward with purpose.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/john-rowley/

item.title: Mike Dillard on Building a Multi-Million Dollar Company From Scratch
item.itunes:title: Mike Dillard on Building a Multi-Million Dollar Company From Scratch
item.description:
Mike Dillard’s journey to incredible success started humbly - he knew he didn’t want to wait tables forever, so he got to work and took control of his story. After years of figuring out what worked with his skill set, Mike zeroed in and made his first million by the age of 27.
 
Now, he shares his experience with others through his podcast, which boasts over 5 million downloads, while running multiple 7-figure businesses and helping other entrepreneurs achieve true mastery and success on their own terms.
 
On this episode of the Underdog Empowerment Podcast, he dives into what it takes to make millions using your unique skills and the art of the finer details. Listen in to start writing your success story.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/mike-dillard/

item.title: Coach Micheal Burt - Monster Producer and Championship Coaching
item.itunes:title: Coach Micheal Burt - Monster Producer and Championship Coaching
item.description:
Coach Micheal Burt is considered “America’s Coach,” a unique blend of a former championship basketball coach combined with a deep methodology of inner-engineering people to produce at a higher level in the business world.
 
Micheal Burt built a multimillion dollar coaching business and formed the Monster Producer coaching program, which is a systematic and consistent program that teaches sales professionals, business owners, and those interested in rapid growth the five big areas to get a significant lift in their business.
 
Burt speaks around the world on his books and growth methodologies and is the personal coach to some of the top performing companies in the world.
 
In this interview, we go deep on what it takes to win consistently.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/micheal-burt/

item.itunes:title: How I Went From Prison To 6 Figure Business Owner
item.description:
If you’re looking for a secret formula to make money, then this isn’t for you.
 
But if you’re committed to doing whatever it takes to level up and WIN in business, then this episode is going to give you a process to follow.
 
It’s not easy. It’s not sexy. And it’s not for soft people.
 
If you got what it takes to get punched in the mouth and keep moving, then this might be for you.
 
This is how I went from prison to 6 figure business owner. Reverse engineered.

item.itunes:title: Dean Graziosi - The Underdog Advantage
item.description:
Dean Graziosi knows how to create success. From extremely humble beginnings Dean started with a firewood business in high school, to a collision repair shop and his first real estate deal before the age of 20. 
 
From there he went on to create a multimillion dollar real estate business, became a Multiple NY Times best selling Author, 16 years everyday on TV and is one of the most watched real estate and success trainers of our generation. 
 
Dean maximized the success and profits in each of these endeavors along his evolution and his businesses and brand have helped change countless lives. 
 
Dean Graziosi is obsessed with sharing the Success Habits learned along this journey with the world.
 
In this interview, we talk about the number one source of power that’s at your disposal right now.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/dean-graziosi/

item.title: Netflix Co-Founder Marc Randolph
item.itunes:title: Netflix Co-Founder Marc Randolph
item.description:
When Netflix execs Marc Randolph and Reed Hastings met with Blockbuster brass in 2000, they wanted to sell for $50 million. Blockbuster all but laughed them out of the room.
 
Netflix is a giant American media-services provider and production company headquartered in Los Gatos, California, founded in 1997 by Marc Randolph and Reed Hastings in Scotts Valley, California.
 
And they put Blockbuster out of business. Underdog shit.
 
In this interview, we talk about innovation, staying ahead of market trends, and being resourceful when you’re the little guy on the block.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/marc-randolph/

item.description:
People want crock-pot results with microwave actions, but that’s not you because you know that shit never last.
 
Chris Cavallini is the CEO of Nutrition Solutions and the host of Start Today Podcast. 
 
Chris figured out the key to experiencing a superior quality of life on both a personal and professional level, starts first with taking control and mastering your physical body.
 
My goal is to help people produce positive, LASTING change and become the upgraded versions of themselves. Chris Cavallini spends his days educating, coaching, and mentoring others so they can experience the same. 
 
Chris Cavallini has the privilege of working with people who are 150-200+ pounds overweight, all the way to professional athletes and celebrities that you see on T.V. on any given day.
 
Chris Cavallini has studied extensively in nutrition, mechanics, strategic intervention (life coaching) and psychology.
 
In this interview, we go deep one the one thing you have to master to dominate life.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/chris-cavallini/

item.title: Michael Altshuler - 30+ Years Of High Performance Results
item.itunes:title: Michael Altshuler - 30+ Years Of High Performance Results
item.description:
At age 22, Michael Altshuler started a copier company that would go on to become a multimillion-dollar business. 
 
Michael Altshuler sold the company to multibillion-dollar industry giant IKON Office Solutions in 1997. 
 
Over the next 20 years, he embarked on several other ventures. Some were successful, and some were not, but all were valuable experiences that shaped who he is, what he does, and how he helps.
 
Michael helps individuals and organizations achieve breakthrough results both personally and professionally. 
 
He is recognized throughout the country as a top expert on Leadership, Sales, and Peak Performance.
 
In this interview, we go deep on what it really means to consistently be a high performer.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/michael-altshuler/

item.title: Mitch Russo - Heroin Addict To Tony Robbins Business Partner
item.itunes:title: Mitch Russo - Heroin Addict To Tony Robbins Business Partner
item.description:
Mitch Russo was the lead guitar player for his high school rock band. 
 
Besides being the best way ever to meet girls, it taught him how to build, run and promote a business. His band; Absolutely Free, was the highest paid high school rock band in his school district, making over $500 a night, and that was in 1970. 
 
In 1985, Mitch co-founded Timeslips Corp, which grew to become the largest time tracking Software Company in the world. In 1994, Timeslips Corp was sold to Sage, plc. While at Sage, Mitch went on to run all of Sage U.S. as Chief Operating Officer, a division with 300 people with a market cap in excess of $100M.
 
Mitch Russo was nominated for Inc. Magazine’s “Entrepreneur of the Year” on two separate occasions, 1989 and 1991.
 
Mitch Russo joined long time friend Chet Holmes and Tony Robbins and together created Business Breakthroughs, Int'l, a company serving thousands of businesses a year with coaching, consulting and training services. Mitch was the President and CEO. 
 
After the untimely death of Chet, Mitch left Business Breakthroughs to help others build their business as a consultant specializing in working with call centers with large volume lead flow and helping coaching organizations scale. 
 
In 2015, Mitch published “The Invisible Organization” which is the CEO’s guide to transitioning a traditional brick and mortar company into a fully virtual organization. 
 
In 2017, Mitch launched a SaaS platform called The Results Breakthrough Network, to match entrepreneurs for the purpose of holding regular accountability sessions to complete their goals and be successful. 
 
In 2018, Mitch published his second book: Power Tribes – How Certification Can Explode Your Business. 
 
Mitch’s Podcast: Your First Thousand Clients, focuses on discovering the secrets of success from business owners who have served 1000 clients or more.
 
TODAY, Mitch helps his clients build recurring revenue streams by using his proprietary certification training and podcasts with super smart business owners. 
 
In this interview, we talk about what it really means to be an entrepreneur building a real company, and how you can get ahead of nearly 90% of everyone in your space.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/mitch-russo/
 
Get More Involved: 
 
  1. Leave A Review & Subscribe On iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/underdog-empowerment/id1373572178
  2. Access Our Top Resource Recommendations: https://underdogempowerment.com/resources/
  3. Join The Elite Underdog Alphas With The Free Underdog Report: https://underdogempowerment.com/report
  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Steve Sims - The Art Of Making Things Happen (Bluefishing)
item.itunes:title: Steve Sims - The Art Of Making Things Happen (Bluefishing)
item.description:
I love conversations with real mother fuckers about getting shit done. This dude is on point.
 
Steve Sims is the founder and CEO of the luxury concierge service Bluefish. In 2017, Sims published a book, Bluefishing: The Art of Making Things Happen.
 
Steve Sims began his career as a Bricklayer in London. In 1980, Steve Sims started a stockbroker job in London, where he worked for about 6 months.
 
Eventually, Steve Sims transferred to Hong Kong where he was fired in 5 days.
 
After losing his stockbroking job, Steve Sims stayed in Hong Kong where he worked as a Doorman for a Night Club in the area, where he went to parties and met their attendees, forming the network that would initially support Bluefish.
 
In this interview, we break down his story and actionable items on how to align yourself with the people who can help you take your business to the next level.
 
Show Notes: https://underdogempowerment.com/steve-sims/
 
Get More Involved:

  4. Subscribe On YouTube: https://underdogempowerment.com/youtube

item.title: Jason Hornung - Multi-Million Net Worth Before 40, What It Takes
item.itunes:title: Jason Hornung - Multi-Million Net Worth Before 40, What It Takes
item.description:
Jason Hornung is the founder and Creative Director at JH Media LLC, the world’s #1 direct response advertising agency focusing exclusively on the Facebook ads platform.
 
Jason’s proprietary methods for ad creation, audience selection and scaling are responsible for producing $20 million + of profitable sales for his clients EVERY YEAR.
 
He is known as the “guru to the gurus” because he’s the mastermind behind hugely profitable campaigns for marketing legends such as Mike Dillard, Frank Kern, Ryan Deiss, Neil Patel, Grace Lever, Sam Ovens and more!
 
In this interview, we go deep on what it takes to be a well known and respected, consistent high-performing business owner.

item.itunes:title: Phil Starkovich - CEO Of TubeBuddy
item.description:
Phil Starkovich is the CEO of TubeBuddy and has been building software in the Social Media space for nearly 15 years. 
 
Phil Starkovich spent the last 5 years focused on YouTube and helping the YouTube community. 
 
TubeBuddy is a browser extension and mobile app used by more than 3 million YouTube creators around the world. 
 
The software focuses on saving people time with productivity tools as well as search engine optimization on YouTube. 
 
In this interview, we discussed the vision for TubeBuddy, early struggles and tough lessons learned, success stories of real people using TubeBuddy, and how you can grow your business with TubeBuddy.

item.title: The Blueprint For Growing Your Email List Fast
item.itunes:title: The Blueprint For Growing Your Email List Fast
item.description:
I wish I got serious about email marketing a lot sooner than I did. It’s the lifeblood to your passive income business.
 
Email marketing is more important than ever with social media platforms killing your organic reach, making you pay to play.
 
In this episode, whether you’re getting into email marketing, just getting started, or been at it for a while, I’m going to give you the blueprint to grow your email list fast.

Pretty much all entrepreneurs get stuck at one point because they are perfectionists and control freaks. They think they can do everything in their business better than anyone else.

item.title: What Is The Underdog Empowerment Podcast
item.itunes:title: What Is The Underdog Empowerment Podcast
item.description:
In the very first episode of the Underdog Empowerment podcast, Zachary Babcock shares how he overcame 5 years in prison, what Underdog Empowerment is. who it's for, who it isn't for, and what you can expect by being a part of the movement.

 

Learn more --> https://underdogempowerment.com
